2025-01-01.prayer: Heavenly Guide, we know it is too easy to be ashamed. We ask that you give us the strength needed to spread your gospel, a story of love and grace. Help us to accept this gift you so freely give. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-01.doctrinal: Paul wrote: I am not ashamed of the gospel. Romans 1:16
2025-01-01.daily_watchword: Do not say, “I am only a boy,” for you shall go to all to whom I send you, and you shall speak whatever I command you. Jeremiah 1:7

2025-01-02.prayer: Spirit of heaven and earth, we give our trust to you. Help us remain unafraid and free from the snares that seek to entrap us. Guide us on the path you have laid before us— one that leads to eternal promise. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-02.doctrinal: Do not be afraid, little flock, for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom. Luke 12:32
2025-01-02.daily_watchword: The fear of others lays a snare, but one who trusts in the Lord is secure. Proverbs 29:25

2025-01-03.prayer: Our Rock and Salvation, you fulfill your promises as surely as a house on a rock holds its foundation. You steady us, you lead us, and you provide for us. May we be a reflection of your love to all we encounter. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-03.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Everyone, then, who hears these words of mine and acts on them will be like a wise man who built his house on rock.” Matthew 7:24
2025-01-03.daily_watchword: Has God promised, and will he not do it? Has he spoken, and will he not fulfill it? Numbers 23:19

2025-01-04.prayer: Merciful God, thank you for choosing us. Thank you for the redemption offered through your son, Jesus Christ. May we receive this grace and commit ourselves fully to you, knowing you have chosen us as your people. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-04.doctrinal: Let us therefore approach the throne of grace with boldness, so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help in time of need. Hebrews 4:16
2025-01-04.daily_watchword: Into your hand I commit my spirit; you have redeemed me, O Lord, faithful God. Psalm 31:5

2025-01-05.prayer: God, our protector, thank you for holding steadfast for us. Help us to hold onto our confidence in you, knowing that you will never break, never bend, never lose sight of your love for us. Help us to be strong like you in our service to one another. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-05.doctrinal: So do not throw away your confidence. Hebrews 10:35 NIV
2025-01-05.daily_watchword: The Lord is good, a stronghold in a day of trouble; he protects those who take refuge in him. Nahum 1:7
2025-01-05.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — God has made known to us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure that he set forth in Christ. Ephesians 1:9

2025-01-06.prayer: Shepherd, guide us to the abiding place you have for us, the green pastures of our soul. Guide us to places where peace and joy may be found. We are your flock and happy to be yours. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-06.doctrinal: You were going astray like sheep, but now you have returned to the shepherd and guardian of your souls. 1 Peter 2:25
2025-01-06.daily_watchword: He makes me lie down in green pastures; he leads me beside still waters; he restores my soul. Psalm 23:2-3
special_remarks: Watchword for the Epiphany — Arise, shine; for your light has come, and the glory of the Lord has risen upon you. Isaiah 60:1
Epiphany of the Lord — Isaiah 60:1-6; Psalm 72:1-7,10-14

2025-01-07.prayer: God above, sometimes we need your discipline so that we may learn how to be better carriers of your word. We do not always treat one another, or ourselves, kindly. Teach us how to be loving bearers of your example. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-07.doctrinal: Jesus taught them as one having authority. Mark 1:22
2025-01-07.daily_watchword: Do not despise the Lord’s discipline or be weary of his reproof. Proverbs 3:11

2025-01-08.prayer: Creator, we rejoice at the wonders that you have brought: the big wonders of creation, miracles, and grand gestures of your might. We also praise you for the small wonders: the sound of laughter and a knowing smile between people. We will sing our joy in praise to you. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-08.doctrinal: The lame man jumped to his feet and began to walk. Then he went with them into the temple courts, walking and jumping, and praising God. Acts 3:8 NIV
2025-01-08.daily_watchword: My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast; I will sing and make melody. Awake, my soul! Psalm 108:1

2025-01-09.prayer: O holy One, the wilderness has much to teach us about ourselves and your kindness. We may not like seasons of wilderness, but we pray that you use these seasons to teach us. Help us grow in strength, humility, and faith. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-09.doctrinal: And the Spirit immediately drove Jesus out into the wilderness. He was in the wilderness forty days, tested by Satan, and he was with the wild beasts, and the angels waited on him. Mark 1:12-13
2025-01-09.daily_watchword: Remember the long way that the Lord your God has led you these forty years in the wilderness, in order to humble you, testing you to know what was in your heart. Deuteronomy 8:2

2025-01-10.prayer: Light of the world, we wait for you. Your example is one of love, even for those deemed as other, less than, or as enemies. Lord, we wait for you to turn our hearts. Help us to see everyone as beloved, just as you see us. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-10.doctrinal: Jesus said, “I give you a new commandment, that you love one another. Just as I have loved you, you also should love one another. By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.” John 13:34-35
2025-01-10.daily_watchword: The Lord said, “If only they had such a mind as this, to fear me and to keep all my commandments always, so that it might go well with them and with their children forever!” Deuteronomy 5:29

2025-01-11.prayer: God, you extend your grace and a sense of peace to all. Fill us with this peace and bring light to all we encounter. May we carry grace with us—for your creation, for humankind, and for ourselves. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-11.doctrinal: Grace to you and peace from him who is and who was and who is to come. Revelation 1:4
2025-01-11.daily_watchword: I will make a covenant of peace with them; it shall be an everlasting covenant with them. Ezekiel 37:26

2025-01-12.prayer: Loving Creator, when we turn away from love, remind us of our call as your people: to love one another; to care for our neighbor. Give us the courage to love boldly in the face of a world brimming with discontent. Help us love one another well. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-12.doctrinal: In this is love, not that we loved God but that he loved us and sent his Son to be the atoning sacrifice for our sins. Beloved, since God loved us so much, we also ought to love one another. 1 John 4:10-11
2025-01-12.daily_watchword: Hatred stirs up strife, but love covers all offenses. Proverbs 10:12
2025-01-12.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — God said, “Do not fear, for I have redeemed you; I have called you by name, you are mine.” Isaiah 43:1

2025-01-13.prayer: Tender God, teach us to turn from the vanities that seek to dim our light. Turn us toward you and the duty you have laid before us—to be an example of Christ in the world. Let our love for you be greater than any desire we may be holding. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-13.doctrinal: Your eye is the lamp of your body. If your eye is healthy, your whole body is full of light, but if it is unhealthy, your body is full of darkness. Luke 11:34
2025-01-13.daily_watchword: Turn my eyes from looking at vanities. Psalm 119:37

2025-01-14.prayer: God of the poor, help us notice our tendencies to ignore poverty, those without homes, those on the margins. Help us to see our overconsumption, our stuffed homes, our ability to give more than we do now. Let us be generous and kind. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-14.doctrinal: Jesus said to the young man, “If you wish to be perfect, go, sell your possessions, and give the money to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; then come, follow me.” Matthew 19:21
2025-01-14.daily_watchword: Whoever is kind to the needy honors God. Proverbs 14:31 NIV

2025-01-15.prayer: Father, Mother, Parent—guide us in our relationships with one another and with you. As the church is your bride,let us together focus on you. Join us in relationship and fellowship with one another, that we may share your light with others. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-15.doctrinal: The husband should give to his wife what is due her and likewise the wife to her husband. 1 Corinthians 7:3
2025-01-15.daily_watchword: You shall not commit adultery. Exodus 20:14

2025-01-16.prayer: Forgiving God, you hold us accountable to you and to one another. Guide us in our journey to humility, recognizing that there are many gifts in the world. Give us hearts that are open to the variety in the world. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-16.doctrinal: God chose what is foolish in the world to shame the wise; God chose what is weak in the world to shame the strong; God chose what is low and despised in the world, things that are not, to abolish things that are, so that no one might boast in the presence of God. 1 Corinthians 1:27-29
2025-01-16.daily_watchword: The haughty eyes of people shall be brought low, and the pride of everyone shall be humbled, and the Lord alone will be exalted on that day. Isaiah 2:11

2025-01-17.prayer: Merciful Judge, you guide us and offer the example of Christian life through your son, Jesus Christ. Give us the courage to follow his example, showing less judgment and more love, even to ourselves. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-17.doctrinal: Therefore, do not pronounce judgment before the time, before the Lord comes, who will bring to light the things now hidden in darkness and will disclose the purposes of the heart. 1 Corinthians 4:5
2025-01-17.daily_watchword: Human ways are under the eyes of the Lord. Proverbs 5:21

2025-01-18.prayer: God in heaven, sometimes we forget the vastness of your might and your love. You are always present for us and ready to share our burdens. Let your gentleness be a model for our lives. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-18.doctrinal: Let your gentleness be known to everyone. The Lord is near. And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus. Philippians 4:5,7
2025-01-18.daily_watchword: So, acknowledge today and take to heart that the Lord is God in heaven above and on the earth beneath; there is no other. Deuteronomy 4:39

2025-01-19.prayer: Guiding Star, you are the one Lord, forevermore. Your light has been made known to the world so that all may follow you. In this season of Epiphany, give us peace and rest so that we may share your love with the world. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-19.doctrinal: Our God is merciful and tender. He will cause the bright dawn of salvation to rise on us and to shine from heaven on all those who live in the dark shadow of death, to guide our steps into the path of peace. Luke 1:78-79 GNT
2025-01-19.daily_watchword: Arise, shine, for your light has come, and the glory of the Lord has risen upon you. Isaiah 60:1
2025-01-19.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Now there are varieties of gifts, but the same spirit; and there are varieties of services, but the same Lord. 1 Corinthians 12:4–5

2025-01-20.prayer: You are light, O God, the gift by which we see. You come to brighten the darkness, to help us to turn toward you. As plants follow the sun’s rays, help us to follow your light. Help us to show your glory in the world. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-20.doctrinal: Jesus said, “And whoever sees me sees him who sent me. I have come as light into the world, so that everyone who believes in me should not remain in the darkness.” John 12:45-46
2025-01-20.daily_watchword: The Lord will be your everlasting light, and your God will be your glory. Isaiah 60:19

2025-01-21.prayer: O Lord, you have given us the promise of eternal life through your son, Jesus Christ. All you ask in return is to trust in you. Hold us to this covenant relationship; guide us on the path of faith. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-21.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Anyone who hears my word and believes him who sent me has eternal life and does not come under judgment but has passed from death to life.” John 5:24
2025-01-21.daily_watchword: Uphold me according to your promise, that I may live, and let me not be put to shame in my hope. Psalm 119:116

2025-01-22.prayer: Savior, you have restored our souls and turned our hearts toward you. We have been unclean; we have blasphemed; we have not served you as we should—yet you still redeem us. Thank you. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-22.doctrinal: Paul wrote: I was formerly a blasphemer, a persecutor, and a man of violence. But I received mercy. 1 Timothy 1:13
2025-01-22.daily_watchword: Isaiah said, “Woe is me! I am lost, for I am a man of unclean lips, and I live among a people of unclean lips.” Isaiah 6:5

2025-01-23.prayer: God of grace and God of glory, we try to fool you and we try to fool ourselves. When we lift ourselves up, feeling the need to justify our actions to others, humble us. Let all we do be done in love and service to you. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-23.doctrinal: Jesus said to the Pharisees, “You are those who justify yourselves in the sight of others, but God knows your hearts.” Luke 16:15
2025-01-23.daily_watchword: Do you think you can fool God the way you fool others? Job 13:9 GNT

2025-01-24.prayer: Messiah, may our eyes be set on you, so that the idols of our times—all the distractions the world—do not remove us from your presence. Guide us back to you; remind us that these are merely idols and do not stand the test of time. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-24.doctrinal: Do nothing from selfish ambition or empty conceit, but in humility regard others as better than yourselves. Philippians 2:3
2025-01-24.daily_watchword: Those who cling to worthless idols turn away from God’s love for them. Jonah 2:8 NIV

2025-01-25.prayer: Mighty God, you have provided for us throughout the years, knowing that goodness and mercy shall come. Help us to see your providing ways. We are never forgotten and never alone. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-25.doctrinal: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, for he has looked favorably on his people and redeemed them. He has raised up a mighty savior for us in the house of his child David. Luke 1:68-69
2025-01-25.daily_watchword: The Lord will again take delight in prospering you, just as he delighted in prospering your ancestors. Deuteronomy 30:9

2025-01-26.prayer: Loving Spirit, as a mother cares for her young, so you care for us. You nurture us, especially when we feel down. A light, you will not dim; you only seek to help us shine brighter. Help us to encourage our youth, ourselves, and the world with your light. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-26.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Take care that you do not despise one of these little ones.” Matthew 18:10
2025-01-26.daily_watchword: A bruised reed he will not break, and a dimly burning wick he will not quench. Isaiah 42:3
2025-01-26.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Let the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable to you, O Lord, my rock and my redeemer. Psalm 19:14

2025-01-27.prayer: Faithful Listener, hear our plea as we lift our voices to you. Through your son, you have thrown open the doors to you; there are no barriers. What greater deed can there be than this? In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-27.doctrinal: This is the confidence we have in approaching God: that if we ask anything according to his will, he hears us. 1 John 5:14 NIV
2025-01-27.daily_watchword: You answer us with awesome and righteous deeds, God our Savior. Psalm 65:5 NIV

2025-01-28.prayer: God, you are our refuge and our safe place. Guard us from the evils of this world—those of our own making, and the things that try to take us from you. We thank you for your protection and ask that you guide us toward your heart alone. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-28.doctrinal: The Lord is faithful; he will strengthen you and guard you from the evil one. 2 Thessalonians 3:3
2025-01-28.daily_watchword: Guard me as the apple of the eye. Psalm 17:8

2025-01-29.prayer: Giver of all, you took on the weight of human need to rescue us from tribulation. May we, in response to your creating, sustaining, and redeeming nature, show our gratitude through our faith, love, and hope. May we continue to seek you in all we do. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-29.doctrinal: You know the generous act of our Lord Jesus Christ, that though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, so that by his poverty you might become rich. 2 Corinthians 8:9
2025-01-29.daily_watchword: David said, “May my life be precious in the sight of the Lord, and may he rescue me from all tribulation.” 1 Samuel 26:24

2025-01-30.prayer: Our Strength and Motivation, sometimes we lose heart. We lose the fire that you set in us to blaze for you. Help us to search inside ourselves for the light that will never be dimmed. Strengthen us to be your hands and feet in the world. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-30.doctrinal: So we do not lose heart. Even though our outer nature is wasting away, our inner nature is being renewed day by day. 2 Corinthians 4:16
2025-01-30.daily_watchword: God, the Lord, is my strength. Habakkuk 3:19

2025-01-31.prayer: Jesus, may we continually praise you in all we do: from our lips, in our hearts, and in our actions. May we declare your goodness to all whom we encounter. Let us live in such a way that every person we meet will feel your presence through us. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-01-31.doctrinal: Peter and John said, “We cannot keep from speaking about what we have seen and heard.” Acts 4:20
2025-01-31.daily_watchword: O Lord, open my lips, and my mouth will declare your praise. Psalm 51:15

2025-02-01.prayer: Lord Jesus, we recognize your sacrifice on the cross as a gift, knowing that you have promised us a better life to come. We sing hymns of praise acknowledging that you are the Lord of both the living and the dead. Amen.
2025-02-01.doctrinal: For to this end Christ died and lived again, so that he might be Lord of both the dead and the living. Romans 14:9
2025-02-01.daily_watchword: Many of those who sleep in the dust of the earth shall awake, some to everlasting life and some to shame and everlasting contempt. Daniel 12:2

2025-02-02.prayer: Lord God, as Abraham answered your call and went where you guided him, help us to hear your voice calling us to do your will and your works here on earth. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-02-02.doctrinal: By faith Abraham obeyed when he was called to set out for a place that he was to receive as an inheritance, and he set out, not knowing where he was going. Hebrews 11:8
2025-02-02.daily_watchword: At the command of the Lord the Israelites would set out, and at the command of the Lord they would camp. Numbers 9:18
2025-02-02.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — For now we see in a mirror, dimly, but then we will see face to face. 1 Corinthians 13:12

2025-02-03.prayer: Ever-present Savior, you know we face challenges in our daily lives. It is a great comfort to know that you knew this life and met your own challenges. Please be with us on our journey—you who helps lighten the burdens of life. Amen.
2025-02-03.doctrinal: Paul wrote: What persecutions I endured! Yet the Lord rescued me from all of them. 2 Timothy 3:11
2025-02-03.daily_watchword: The hand of our God was upon us, and he delivered us. Ezra 8:31

2025-02-04.prayer: God of all, we are grateful for your promise made flesh in Christ our Savior. May we hold Jesus’ lessons in our hearts and reflect them to others this and every day. Amen.
2025-02-04.doctrinal: Indeed, the word of God is living and active and sharper than any two-edged sword, piercing until it divides soul from spirit, joints from marrow; it is able to judge the thoughts and intentions of the heart. Hebrews 4:12
2025-02-04.daily_watchword: Is not my word like fire, says the Lord, and like a hammer that breaks a rock in pieces? Jeremiah 23:29

2025-02-05.prayer: Holy Lord, your might is in love, truth, and compassion. Help us remember it has no place for a domineering will to win. May the peace of your love direct our thoughts, words, and deeds. Amen.
2025-02-05.doctrinal: Jesus said, “No one has greater love than this, to lay down one’s life for one’s friends.” John 15:13
2025-02-05.daily_watchword: The suffering servant said, “I gave my back to those who struck me and my cheeks to those who pulled out the beard; I did not hide my face from insult and spitting.” Isaiah 50:6

2025-02-06.prayer: Dearest Jesus, there are no words to thank you for your gift of salvation. May we honor it every minute of every day by following God’s will and always putting others first. Amen.
2025-02-06.doctrinal: God did not send the Son into the world to condemn the world but in order that the world might be saved through him. John 3:17
2025-02-06.daily_watchword: The Lord said in his heart, “I will never again curse the ground because of humans, for the inclination of the human heart is evil from youth.” Genesis 8:21

2025-02-07.prayer: God, who leads us beside still waters and restores our soul, refresh the parched places of our lives and quench our thirst for peace, confidence in faith, and reconciliation with those for whom we share life—both near to our daily lives and those far removed by national, philosophical, and theological borders. Amen.
2025-02-07.doctrinal: Let everyone who is thirsty come. Let anyone who wishes take the water of life as a gift. Revelation 22:17
2025-02-07.daily_watchword: O God, you are my God; I seek you; my soul thirsts for you. Psalm 63:1

2025-02-08.prayer: Renewing God, when we find ourselves at the table together in Christ’s name, may we be reminded not only of the sacredness of your self-giving love, but may we also be inspired to give of ourselves in care and service to others near to heart and hand. May Christ’s grace and mercy be that which we not only receive, but which we offer daily with glad heart and mind. Amen.
2025-02-08.doctrinal: The cup of blessing that we bless, is it not a sharing in the blood of Christ? The bread that we break, is it not a sharing in the body of Christ? 1 Corinthians 10:16
2025-02-08.daily_watchword: He has gained renown by his wonderful deeds; the Lord is gracious and merciful. Psalm 111:4

2025-02-09.prayer: God who whispers into the everyday moments of life, open our ears that our hearts may hear and understand your word. We dedicate our whole selves to your purposes. Truly, may our ears hear…may our eyes see	may our hands work…that we will yet be the living reminders of your grace in this day. Amen.
2025-02-09.doctrinal: Jesus said, “But as for what was sown on good soil, this is the one who hears the word and understands it, who indeed bears fruit and yields in one case a hundredfold, in another sixty, and in another thirty.” Matthew 13:23
2025-02-09.daily_watchword: God said to Ezekiel, “Mortal, all my words that I shall speak to you receive in your heart and hear with your ears.” Ezekiel 3:10
2025-02-09.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — The Lord will fulfill his purpose for me; your steadfast love, O Lord, endures forever. Psalm 138:8

2025-02-10.prayer: God of all, teach us so we may gain wisdom to discern your truth and be saved. Help us to proclaim your saving grace to all and to lead others to follow you. Amen.
2025-02-10.doctrinal: God desires everyone to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth. 1 Timothy 2:4
2025-02-10.daily_watchword: With God are strength and wisdom; the deceived and the deceiver are his. Job 12:16

2025-02-11.prayer: Great Redeemer, remind us that it is not our place to judge or to show partiality. All your children are equally worthy of our love, care, and respect. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-02-11.doctrinal: Do not claim the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ of glory while showing partiality. James 2:1
2025-02-11.daily_watchword: You shall not be partial to the poor or defer to the great. Leviticus 19:15

2025-02-12.prayer: God of love, make us peacemakers in our troubled world. Help us to fight greed and injustice; help us to find the good in all those around us. In your heavenly name, we pray. Amen.
2025-02-12.doctrinal: Let love be genuine; hate what is evil; hold fast to what is good. Romans 12:9
2025-02-12.daily_watchword: From the least to the greatest of them, everyone is greedy for unjust gain; and from prophet to priest, everyone deals falsely. They have treated the wound of my people carelessly, saying, “Peace, peace,” when there is no peace. Jeremiah 6:13-14

2025-02-13.prayer: As we walk through life, guiding God, help us to avoid the dangers and distractions that tempt us to stray. Like the saints before us, help us to walk with you, diligently serving and patiently trusting that we will see your promises fulfilled and your will be done on earth as it is in heaven. Amen.
2025-02-13.doctrinal: We want each one of you to show the same diligence so as to realize the full assurance of hope to the very end, so that you may not become sluggish but imitators of those who through faith and patience inherit the promises. Hebrews 6:11-12
2025-02-13.daily_watchword: God said, “Ask for the ancient paths, where the good way lies; and walk in it, and find rest for your souls.” Jeremiah 6:16

2025-02-14.prayer: We avert our eyes, suffering Lord. We avoid looking at you in the hungry, homeless, and hopeless. We do not want to see you broken and vulnerable. And yet, how can we help but behold you, to see your love, your desire to be one of us, your desire to save us? Amen.
2025-02-14.doctrinal: Pilate said to them, “Behold the man!” John 19:5
2025-02-14.daily_watchword: Like one from whom people hide their faces he was despised, and we held him in low esteem. Isaiah 53:3 NIV

2025-02-15.prayer: God, we cry out to you in hurt, disappointment, and grief. We cry out even as Jesus cried out to you in despair. Hear us, spare us, and lift us up, even as, after his suffering, you lifted Jesus up to new life. Amen.
2025-02-15.doctrinal: In the days of his flesh, Jesus offered up prayers and supplications, with loud cries and tears, to the one who was able to save him from death, and he was heard because of his reverent submission. Hebrews 5:7
2025-02-15.daily_watchword: O my God, I cry by day, but you do not answer; and by night but find no rest. Psalm 22:2

2025-02-16.prayer: Almighty God, today we pray for power. We pray not for the capacity to do whatever we want or to manipulate and defeat others, but for the capacity to enact change, to stand for justice, and to actively love ourselves, our neighbors, and our world. Amen.
2025-02-16.doctrinal: Paul wrote: The Lord said to me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for power is made perfect in weakness.” 2 Corinthians 12:9
2025-02-16.daily_watchword: He gives power to the faint and strengthens the powerless. Isaiah 40:29
2025-02-16.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Blessed are those who trust in the Lord, whose trust is the Lord. Jeremiah 17:7

2025-02-17.prayer: God of the Ages, since the time of psalmist and apostles, your steadfast love and faithful presence inspired generations to live out your gospel story. Now we are the generations who hear your call to receive and share your love. Inspire and embolden us, we pray! Amen.
2025-02-17.doctrinal: Paul wrote: We had courage in our God to declare to you the gospel of God in spite of great opposition. 1 Thessalonians 2:2
2025-02-17.daily_watchword: I have spoken of your faithfulness and your salvation; I have not concealed your steadfast love and your faithfulness from the great congregation. Psalm 40:10

2025-02-18.prayer: Holy Sustainer and Comforter, you know that we will go to extraordinary lengths to hide our fears, flaws, and insecurities. Forgive us and comfort us when that prevents us from living with empathy and authenticity. Remind us that you live in us, around us, and through us, just as we are. Amen.
2025-02-18.doctrinal: Jesus said, “When they bring you before the synagogues, the rulers, and the authorities, do not worry about how or what you will answer or what you are to say, for the Holy Spirit will teach you at that very hour what you ought to say.” Luke 12:11-12
2025-02-18.daily_watchword: You will know that I am the Lord; those who wait for me shall not be put to shame. Isaiah 49:23

2025-02-19.prayer: Giver of life, you reach out with abundance and provision at every turn. All too often it is hard to have eyes to see it, trust to loosen our desires for control, or willingness to give up the outcomes we prefer. Help us receive the life you offer with open hands. Amen.
2025-02-19.doctrinal: Simon answered, “Master, we have worked all night long but have caught nothing. Yet if you say so, I will let down the nets.” When they had done this, they caught so many fish that their nets were beginning to burst. Luke 5:5-6
2025-02-19.daily_watchword: Unless the Lord builds the house, those who build it labor in vain. Psalm 127:1

2025-02-20.prayer: El Roi—you, O God who sees us, guide us to trust that you see each of us and the larger landscape of all creation better than we can. Help us hear you calling us by our truest name—beloved children—that we might see one another as you do. Amen.
2025-02-20.doctrinal: And will not God grant justice to his chosen ones who cry to him day and night? Will he delay long in helping them? Luke 18:7
2025-02-20.daily_watchword: The Lord will vindicate his people and have compassion on his servants. Deuteronomy 32:36

2025-02-21.prayer: Shepherd of souls, call us out of the sheepfold, the comfortable places of safety in our lives, that we might go out into the world with curiosity to discover the ways your love shows up. You don’t just call us to follow, you invite us to lead others to discover you in unexpected places. Amen.
2025-02-21.doctrinal: Christ himself granted that some are apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors, and teachers to equip the saints for the work of ministry, for building up the body of Christ. Ephesians 4:11-12
2025-02-21.daily_watchword: Shepherd your people with your staff. Micah 7:14

2025-02-22.prayer: Righteous and forgiving Savior, lead us daily on a path toward justice for all our brothers and sisters everywhere. Help us to always remember your commandment to love one another as you have loved us. Amen.
2025-02-22.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be filled.” Matthew 5:6
2025-02-22.daily_watchword: Justice, and only justice, you shall pursue, so that you may live. Deuteronomy 16:20

2025-02-23.prayer: Redeeming and loving God, strengthen our hearts and souls in the face of life’s challenges, dangers, turmoil, and stresses. Remind us to keep our faith strong in your resurrected son, Jesus Christ, our Lord, until he comes again. Amen.
2025-02-23.doctrinal: Jesus got up and rebuked the wind and the raging waters; the storm subsided, and all was calm. “Where is your faith?” he asked his disciples. Luke 8:24-25 NIV
2025-02-23.daily_watchword: The Lord said, “Then I will encamp at my house as a guard.” Zechariah 9:8
2025-02-23.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Jesus said, “Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.” Luke 6:36

2025-02-24.prayer: Holy Spirit, steer us away from the temptations and distractions of life. Direct our thoughts and actions to your children in need, offering in your name your faithful care, love, comfort, presence, and reassurance. Amen.
2025-02-24.doctrinal: Do not get drunk with wine, for that is debauchery, but be filled with the Spirit. Ephesians 5:18
2025-02-24.daily_watchword: You drink wine by the bowlful and use the finest lotions, but you do not grieve over the ruin of Joseph. Amos 6:6 NIV

2025-02-25.prayer: Almighty God, you are our strength and salvation. In our prayers, we seek solace from suffering; in our songs, we offer you our praise and thanksgiving. Guide us in helping others find joy and hope in reaching out to you. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-02-25.doctrinal: Are any among you suffering? They should pray. Are any cheerful? They should sing songs of praise. James 5:13
2025-02-25.daily_watchword: The Lord is my strength and my might; he has become my salvation. Psalm 118:14

2025-02-26.prayer: Gentle Wind, we long to feel your presence throughout our days. We sometimes lack the faith and vision to see your works and learn your ways, yet, deep down, we sense your Spirit guiding all that surrounds us. May we never feel apart from you. In the name of the Spirit, we pray. Amen.
2025-02-26.doctrinal: Jesus said, “The wind blows where it chooses, and you hear the sound of it, but you do not know where it comes from or where it goes. So it is with everyone who is born of the Spirit.” John 3:8
2025-02-26.daily_watchword: Who has directed the Spirit of the Lord or as his counselor has instructed him? Isaiah 40:13

2025-02-27.prayer: Loving Lord, our hearts are yours. You shower us with all that is good and comfort us in our sorrows. Help us to recognize your will as our own and to turn away from all that deters us from your service. In your holy name, we pray. Amen.
2025-02-27.doctrinal: So do not be foolish, but understand what the will of the Lord is. Ephesians 5:17
2025-02-27.daily_watchword: Samuel said to the people, “Serve the Lord with all your heart, and do not turn aside after useless things that cannot profit or save, for they are useless.” 1 Samuel 12:20-21

2025-02-28.prayer: Uplifting Savior, you are present with us in our trials and tribulations, our fears and doubts, our suffering and hardships. In your death and resurrection, we receive the promise of everlasting life. We pray that we can carry the hope your love provides in our bodies forevermore. Amen.
2025-02-28.doctrinal: We are persecuted but not forsaken, struck down but not destroyed, always carrying around in the body the death of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may also be made visible in our bodies. 2 Corinthians 4:9-10
2025-02-28.daily_watchword: You let people ride over our heads; we went through fire and through water; yet you have brought us out to a spacious place. Psalm 66:12

2025-03-01.prayer: Eternal God, as we mark the beginning of our global church, we know that our faith history is but a moment in your creation. Yet you give us each these moments to blossom and live abundant lives. Let it be so! Amen.
2025-03-01.doctrinal: “I am the Alpha and the Omega,” said the Lord God, who is and who was and who is to come, the Almighty. Revelation 1:8
2025-03-01.daily_watchword: Remember the former things of old, for I am God, and there is no other; I am God, and there is no one like me. Isaiah 46:9
special_remarks: Beginning of the Unity of the Brethren in Bohemia

2025-03-02.prayer: In the mountaintops and the valleys of life, wherever we are, O Lord, let us call upon you, for your grace, mercy, and peace will lift us up. In Jesus’ holy name, we pray. Amen.
2025-03-02.doctrinal: There were two blind men sitting by the roadside. When they heard that Jesus was passing by, they shouted, “Lord, have mercy on us, Son of David!” Matthew 20:30
2025-03-02.daily_watchword: In his love and pity, it was the Lord who redeemed them; he lifted them up and carried them all the days of old. Isaiah 63:9
2025-03-02.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — And when they looked up, they saw no one except Jesus alone. Matthew 17:8

2025-03-03.prayer: Life-giving Savior, all we have is from you. Remind us when we doubt ourselves. Renew us when we fail others. Reengage us when we are weary in body, mind, and spirit. For your love’s sake. Amen.
2025-03-03.doctrinal: The gate is narrow and the road is hard that leads to life. Matthew 7:14
2025-03-03.daily_watchword: Search me, O God, and know my heart; test me and know my thoughts. See if there is any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting. Psalm 139:23-24

2025-03-04.prayer: Lord Jesus, when have we failed to recognize you dwelling among us? Open our eyes to see your presence in our neighbor. Open our hearts to let you in. Open our spirits for new ways to understand your eternal presence. Amen.
2025-03-04.doctrinal: When Jesus entered Jerusalem, the whole city was in turmoil, asking, “Who is this?” Matthew 21:10
2025-03-04.daily_watchword: “Sing and rejoice, O daughter Zion! For I will come and dwell in your midst,” said the Lord. Zechariah 2:10

2025-03-05.prayer: Forgiving God, you show us amazing grace. Turn your face from our sins and blot out all our iniquities. In humility and with repentance, let us return to you this day and throughout our Lenten journey. Amen.
2025-03-05.doctrinal: The wages of sin is death, but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord. Romans 6:23
2025-03-05.daily_watchword: Your sins have hidden his face from you so that he does not hear. Isaiah 59:2

2025-03-06.prayer: God of hope, as the sun will rise today, may our lives be ever orientated to the possibilities ahead of us. Lifting high the hope of God’s never-failing love, let us march forward this day. Amen.
2025-03-06.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Many will come from east and west and will take their places at the banquet with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.” Matthew 8:11
2025-03-06.daily_watchword: “From the rising of the sun to its setting my name is great among the nations,” said the Lord of hosts. Malachi 1:11

2025-03-07.prayer: Christ, eternal word, remind us to always center our words in you and speak from places of love. Forgive us when we are quick to respond with a cutting word or a cruel retort. Center our words in your eternal truth. Amen.
2025-03-07.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Let your word be ‘Yes, Yes’ or ‘No, No’; anything more than this comes from the evil one.” Matthew 5:37
2025-03-07.daily_watchword: When words are many, transgression is not lacking, but the prudent are restrained in speech. Proverbs 10:19

2025-03-08.prayer: God of the eternal covenant, you search and seek us, even when we shut the doors of our hearts. Let us seek you, knowing that it is in the journey toward you that we find new life. Amen.
2025-03-08.doctrinal: Simon Peter answered Jesus, “Lord, to whom can we go? You have the words of eternal life.” John 6:68
2025-03-08.daily_watchword: Thus said the Lord: Seek me and live. Amos 5:4

2025-03-09.prayer: Forgive us, Lord, when we forget that believing is not seeing. Rather, it is living with hope and seeking your presence in our journeys that we find faith. As we seek, may we be filled with joy, peace, and hope, ever mindful of the Spirit’s power within. Amen.
2025-03-09.doctrinal: May the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, so that you may abound in hope by the power of the Holy Spirit. Romans 15:13
2025-03-09.daily_watchword: Let the hearts of those who seek the Lord rejoice. Psalm 105:3
2025-03-09.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — No one who believes in Christ will be put to shame. Romans 10:11

2025-03-10.prayer: Abiding God, with each breath, may we bring your peace into our spirit. When we exhale, may your peace enter our world through the words and actions of our lives. We pray in Jesus’ name. Amen.
2025-03-10.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled, and do not let them be afraid.” John 14:27
2025-03-10.daily_watchword: I will both lie down and sleep in peace, for you alone, O Lord, make me lie down in safety. Psalm 4:8

2025-03-11.prayer: God of all ages, in life, death, and the life to come, you are our creator and sustainer. Whether we live or die, may our witness and service to others always point to you and the present and coming kingdom of God. Amen.
2025-03-11.doctrinal: Therefore, brothers and sisters, be all the more eager to confirm your call and election, for if you do this, you will never stumble. For in this way, entry into the eternal kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ will be richly provided for you. 2 Peter 1:10-11
2025-03-11.daily_watchword: Joshua said to the people, “You are witnesses against yourselves that you have chosen the Lord, to serve him.” And they said, “We are witnesses.” Joshua 24:22

2025-03-12.prayer: This season of Lent is for returning to you, Lord Jesus. Remembering your sacrifice, we confess our shortcomings and transgressions, yet also remember your forgiveness as we are received anew. Amen.
2025-03-12.doctrinal: By his wounds you have been healed. 1 Peter 2:24
2025-03-12.daily_watchword: In those days and at that time, says the Lord, the iniquity of Israel shall be sought, and there shall be none, and the sins of Judah, and none shall be found, for I will pardon the remnant that I have spared. Jeremiah 50:20

2025-03-13.prayer: O life-affirming Creator, how often we forget that we are your beloved creation: chosen, created, and named, as you proclaimed, “It is good.” Call us out of our doubts and our fears to live with you. Amen.
2025-03-13.doctrinal: You are a chosen people, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, God’s own people, in order that you may proclaim the excellence of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light. 1 Peter 2:9
2025-03-13.daily_watchword: Noah found favor in the sight of the Lord. Genesis 6:8

2025-03-14.prayer: One who goes by many names, but is our Lord and Savior, center us now. Whether we labor or rest, you are the God who is within, above, before, and behind us—graciously leading us with your abiding love. Amen.
2025-03-14.doctrinal: The same Lord is Lord of all and is generous to all who call on him. Romans 10:12
2025-03-14.daily_watchword: The Lord will become king over all the earth; on that day the Lord will be one and his name one. Zechariah 14:9

2025-03-15.prayer: Gracious God, awaken our hearts to see the glorious beauty in this new day. Refresh our minds and renew our spirits, as we accept the gift of new beginnings. Give us courage to start over as we trust in your goodness and love. Thank you for the hope and promise of new life in Jesus Christ, our redeemer. Amen.
2025-03-15.doctrinal: So if anyone is in Christ, there is a new creation: everything old has passed away; look, new things have come into being! 2 Corinthians 5:17
2025-03-15.daily_watchword: You shall be called by a new name that the mouth of the Lord will give. Isaiah 62:2

2025-03-16.prayer: O God of mercy, forgive our stubborn and prideful hearts. So often, when our lives are easy, we forget to thank you. Yet, when our hearts are broken and we feel lost, we remember you and seek your guidance and strength. Shepherd of our souls, increase our dependence upon you. Grant us faith to declare, “It is well with my soul.” Amen.
2025-03-16.doctrinal: Jesus said, “You have pain now, but I will see you again, and your hearts will rejoice, and no one will take your joy from you.” John 16:22
2025-03-16.daily_watchword: As for me, I said in my prosperity, “I shall never be moved.” You hid your face; I was dismayed. Psalm 30:6,7
2025-03-16.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? Psalm 27:1

2025-03-17.prayer: Precious Savior, your tender mercy surpasses human understanding. Through your sacrificial death on the cross, you forgave us and paid the debt for our sins. Through your resurrection, you promised us the gift of abiding with you forever. May we surrender our hearts to you so we may come to know the immeasurable riches of your grace through your kindness and love toward us in Christ Jesus. Amen.
2025-03-17.doctrinal: Mary said, “God has come to the aid of his child Israel, in remembrance of his mercy.” Luke 1:54
2025-03-17.daily_watchword: Who is a God like you, pardoning iniquity and passing over the transgression of the remnant of his possession? He does not retain his anger forever because he delights in showing steadfast love. Micah 7:18

2025-03-18.prayer: Almighty God, support and sustain us when we are afraid. Protect us from danger and rescue us from despair. Forgive us for not trusting in your constant presence. Guide us in the choices we make, and help us to place our confidence in you, O Lord, and only in you. In your gracious name, we pray. Amen.
2025-03-18.doctrinal: Paul wrote: I know the one in whom I have put my trust, and I am sure that he is able to guard the deposit I have entrusted to him. 2 Timothy 1:12
2025-03-18.daily_watchword: O Lord, my strength and my stronghold, my refuge in the day of trouble. Jeremiah 16:19

2025-03-19.prayer: Awesome God, you are the creator of all things. Although we are made in your image, we are limited in what we can see and understand. Teach us, inspire us, and fill us with your Spirit, so that despite our weakness, we can answer your call to serve you. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-03-19.doctrinal: Paul wrote: Now I know only in part; then I will know fully, even as I have been fully known. 1 Corinthians 13:12
2025-03-19.daily_watchword: Job answered the Lord, “See, I am of small account; what shall I answer you? I lay my hand on my mouth.” Job 40:3-4

2025-03-20.prayer: Gracious God, you are always with us. When we call out to you in our moments of distress, you hear us and lovingly lead us beside still waters. Come into our hearts and embrace us with your gentle presence. Grant us strength and courage as we share this message of your eternal and abiding love. Amen.
2025-03-20.doctrinal: Jesus said, “For everyone who asks receives, and everyone who searches finds, and for everyone who knocks, the door will be opened.” Luke 11:10
2025-03-20.daily_watchword: On the day I called, you answered me; you increased my strength of soul. Psalm 138:3

2025-03-21.prayer: Almighty God, forgive us when we have not humbled ourselves before you and before our neighbor. Quiet our minds so we can be still and hear your voice. Inspire us to serve as we model the compassionate love of Jesus, and may our words and actions be pleasing to you. In your holy name, we pray. Amen.
2025-03-21.doctrinal: A dispute also arose among them as to which one of them was to be regarded as the greatest. But Jesus said to them, “The kings of the gentiles lord it over them, and those in authority over them are called benefactors. But not so with you; rather, the greatest among you must become like the youngest and the leader like one who serves.” Luke 22:24-26
2025-03-21.daily_watchword: To the humble the Lord shows favor. Proverbs 3:34

2025-03-22.prayer: Spirit of the living God, thank you for your holy presence. It is so easy to fill our lives with matters of this world. Grant us wisdom and discernment and fill our hearts and minds with renewed vision, so we can more clearly see the life to which you have called us. In your holy name, we pray. Amen.
2025-03-22.doctrinal: Peter said, “Jesus, being therefore exalted at the right hand of God and having received from the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, he has poured out this that you see and hear.” Acts 2:33
2025-03-22.daily_watchword: The Lord said, “And afterward, I will pour out my Spirit on all people.” Joel 2:28 NIV

2025-03-23.prayer: Gracious God, help us to sing aloud of your great and eternal love. Equip us, Lord, and fill us with gifts from your spirit, so that we can witness to our neighbor and make known to all, of your deep and abiding love, both now and evermore. Amen.
2025-03-23.doctrinal: Paul wrote: To this day I have had help from God, and so I stand here, testifying to both small and great. Acts 26:22
2025-03-23.daily_watchword: I will sing aloud of your steadfast love in the morning. For you have been a fortress for me and a refuge in the day of my distress. Psalm 59:16
2025-03-23.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Seek the Lord while he may be found, call upon him while he is near. Isaiah 55:6

2025-03-24.prayer: Gracious Lord, remind us that you are our Lord, and you are always with us. Draw us closer to you as we learn to recognize your presence. Help us be faithful to your leading. We praise you for your goodness and love and for your tender mercy in our lives. Amen.
2025-03-24.doctrinal: Jesus said to them, “Come and have breakfast.” Now none of the disciples dared to ask him, “Who are you?” because they knew it was the Lord. John 21:12
2025-03-24.daily_watchword: Samuel said, “It is the Lord; let him do what seems good to him.” 1 Samuel 3:18

2025-03-25.prayer: Holy God, you call us to live our lives in service to you. Help us to walk with you in righteousness and holiness as we surrender our hearts and minds, serving you with joyful obedience. Give us the peace to know that all will be well. Amen.
2025-03-25.doctrinal: As he who called you is holy, be holy yourselves in all your conduct. 1 Peter 1:15
2025-03-25.daily_watchword: Noah was a righteous man, blameless in his generation; Noah walked with God. Genesis 6:9

2025-03-26.prayer: God of comfort, you know our deep sadness and weariness. You hear our cries and see our heavy burdens. Because of your profound love for us, you offer to take our grief and pain, and in their place, give our souls a quiet stillness and a peaceful resting place until we are united with you in joyful bliss. Amen.
2025-03-26.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Come to me, all you who are weary and are carrying heavy burdens, and I will give you rest.” Matthew 11:28
2025-03-26.daily_watchword: This poor soul cried and was heard by the Lord and was saved from every trouble. Psalm 34:6

2025-03-27.prayer: God of all creation, we bow before you with praise and adoration. May your Holy Spirit work within us to keep our minds and hearts focused on you. As we live in community with others, help us to reflect your goodness and love so that our entire lives can be an offering of thanksgiving. Amen.
2025-03-27.doctrinal: Day by day, as they spent much time together in the temple, they broke bread at home and ate their food with glad and generous hearts, praising God and having the goodwill of all the people. Acts 2:46-47
2025-03-27.daily_watchword: Bless God in the great congregation. Psalm 68:26

2025-03-28.prayer: Loving Shepherd, you hold us tenderly in your embrace. Just as we have received your protection and comfort, open our eyes to those around us, and grant us courage to proclaim the good news, so that they, too, may know the grace and hope of your eternal love. Yea, our lot is blessed. Alleluia! Amen.
2025-03-28.doctrinal: Jesus said to the disciples, “Go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel. As you go, proclaim the good news, ‘The kingdom of heaven has come near.’” Matthew 10:6-7
2025-03-28.daily_watchword: Like birds hovering overhead, so the Lord of hosts will protect Jerusalem; he will protect and deliver it; he will spare and rescue it. Isaiah 31:5

2025-03-29.prayer: Most holy Lord and God, fill us with your spirit as we seek your presence with reverence and awe. Forgive us when we act foolishly and ignore your still, small voice that guides our hearts and minds into making decisions that honor you. Create in us a deep desire to give you our best as we praise you in our places of worship, and in how we interact with others. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-03-29.doctrinal: Jesus was teaching and saying, “Is it not written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations’?” Mark 11:17
2025-03-29.daily_watchword: The Lord is in his holy temple; let all the earth keep silence before him! Habakkuk 2:20

2025-03-30.prayer: Holy God, nothing can separate us from your love. Provide us patience and peace amidst our suffering, and forgive us when we are the reason for someone else’s suffering. With Jesus as our model, guide us in humility and righteousness. Inspire us to live in faith as we boldly approach your eternal throne and claim your crown. Through Jesus Christ, we pray. Amen.
2025-03-30.doctrinal: Blessed are those who are persecuted for the sake of righteousness, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven. Matthew 5:10
2025-03-30.daily_watchword: He is the Lord our God; his judgments are in all the earth. Psalm 105:7
2025-03-30.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — If anyone is in Christ, there is a new creation: everything old has passed away; see, everything has become new! 2 Corinthians 5:17

2025-03-31.prayer: Creator God, we offer you our hymns of praise and thanksgiving. We thank you for the many ways that you bless us and shower us with your unconditional love and grace. Most of all, we thank you for the gift of Christ Jesus, who is the resurrection and the life. Amen.
2025-03-31.doctrinal: With gratitude in your hearts sing psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs to God. Colossians 3:16
2025-03-31.daily_watchword: All your works shall give thanks to you, O Lord, and all your faithful shall bless you. Psalm 145:10

2025-04-01.prayer: Divine Supplier, thank you for the gift of nourishment, filling not only our mouths, but our hearts and minds with the fruit of your love, justice, and compassion. Grant that every tongue and heart may know of your abundant love and mercy. Amen.
2025-04-01.doctrinal: He who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food will supply and multiply your seed for sowing and increase the harvest of your righteousness. 2 Corinthians 9:10
2025-04-01.daily_watchword: The Lord upholds the cause of the oppressed and gives food to the hungry. Psalm 146:7 NIV

2025-04-02.prayer: Honorable and graceful Potter, you formed us from clay and continue to mold us, even as we deform and unravel ourselves. We thank you for your infinite mercy, wisdom, and constant guiding hands. Shape us into useful servants. Amen.
2025-04-02.doctrinal: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and the God of all consolation. 2 Corinthians 1:3
2025-04-02.daily_watchword: “A son honors his father. If then I am a father, where is the honor due me?” said the Lord. Malachi 1:6

2025-04-03.prayer: Source of life, grant us the faith to take the cup of everlasting life and mercy given to us, and grant us the courage to take a sip and live as you intend, knowing that we are never far from your love. Amen.
2025-04-03.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Those who drink of the water that I will give them will never be thirsty. The water that I will give will become in them a spring of water gushing up to eternal life.” John 4:14
2025-04-03.daily_watchword: My people have committed two evils: they have forsaken me, the fountain of living water, and dug out cisterns for themselves, cracked cisterns that can hold no water. Jeremiah 2:13

2025-04-04.prayer: Compassionate Shepherd, guide us with your crook of mercy and forgiveness into a life of truth and repentance. May we follow your path faithfully and embody your example of agape love with every step we take. In the name of Jesus, we pray. Amen.
2025-04-04.doctrinal: If we confess our sins, he who is faithful and just will forgive us our sins and cleanse us from all unrighteousness. 1 John 1:9
2025-04-04.daily_watchword: You will again have compassion on us; you will hurl all our iniquities into the depths of the sea. Micah 7:19 NIV

2025-04-05.prayer: O Jesus, guardian of our souls, sing to us that we may hear and receive your love and glory. Humble us in your presence, and teach us to serve our neighbors in need, lifting them up above ourselves. Amen.
2025-04-05.doctrinal: I say to everyone among you not to think of yourself more highly than you ought to think but to think with sober judgment, each according to the measure of faith that God has assigned. Romans 12:3
2025-04-05.daily_watchword: The Lord makes poor and makes rich; he brings low; he also exalts. 1 Samuel 2:7

2025-04-06.prayer: Our Chief Elder, govern our lives with love and open our hearts to the poor, the broken-hearted, and the lost. Lead us in the way of life and peace. Create in us a spirit of boldness and lead us into your way of willing sacrifice for others. Amen.
2025-04-06.doctrinal: And the king will answer them, ‘Truly I tell you, just as you did it to one of the least of these brothers and sisters of mine, you did it to me.’ Matthew 25:40
2025-04-06.daily_watchword: Bring the homeless poor into your house. Isaiah 58:7
2025-04-06.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Forgetting what lies behind and straining forward to what lies ahead, I press on toward the goal for the prize of the heavenly call of God in Christ Jesus. Philippians 3:13,14

2025-04-07.prayer: Bringer of truth and justice, not only do you forgive and heal, not only do you satisfy and renew, but you also bring justice and righteousness. Give us the courage to pursue change and justice for the othered in society; help us to do what is right in your sight. Amen.
2025-04-07.doctrinal: Anyone, then, who knows the right thing to do and fails to do it commits sin. James 4:17
2025-04-07.daily_watchword: The Lord works vindication and justice for all who are oppressed. Psalm 103:6

2025-04-08.prayer: Merciful Lord, in a world of hurt and sickness, bestow on us the strength to endure and press on. Raise your thunderous voice of mercy over the cries of evil and hatred. Rally your servants, calling us each by name and sanctifying us to become messengers by abundant love and grace. Amen.
2025-04-08.doctrinal: Jesus said to Simon, “I have prayed for you that your own faith may not fail, and you, when once you have turned back, strengthen your brothers.” Luke 22:32
2025-04-08.daily_watchword: The Lord your God is gracious and merciful and will not turn away his face from you, if you return to him. 2 Chronicles 30:9

2025-04-09.prayer: Blessed Teacher, you set the example of love and sacrifice that we must follow. Shine through us as we endeavor to meet people where they are, whether in broken-heartedness, loneliness, poverty, or homelessness. May we bring them your loving and life-sustaining compassion. Amen.
2025-04-09.doctrinal: Jesus said, “I have set you an example, that you also should do as I have done to you.” John 13:15
2025-04-09.daily_watchword: Those who look to him are radiant; their faces are never covered with shame. Psalm 34:5 NIV

2025-04-10.prayer: Almighty God, your hands are mighty, but the touch of your mercy is gentle and sure. Surround us in your wings of refuge, guide us steadily with strength and resolve, and bestow the wondrous blessings of your love upon us, your humble servants. Amen.
2025-04-10.doctrinal: Humble yourselves, therefore, under the mighty hand of God, so that he may exalt you in due time. 1 Peter 5:6
2025-04-10.daily_watchword: It is in your hand, O Lord, to make great and to give strength to all. 1 Chronicles 29:12

2025-04-11.prayer: Gracious God, your everlasting love is undeniable. Thank you for being the constant, abiding presence in our world of rapid change. Blessing, honor, glory, and power are yours, our God, forever. Be with us always. Amen.
2025-04-11.doctrinal: John wrote: I heard every creature in heaven and on earth and under the earth and in the sea and all that is in them, singing, “To the one seated on the throne and to the Lamb be blessing and honor and glory and might forever and ever!” Revelation 5:13
2025-04-11.daily_watchword: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and your dominion endures throughout all generations. Psalm 145:13

2025-04-12.prayer: Bread of life, fill us anew with purpose and courage. Feed us, your people in the wilderness. Work with us and within us, your servants on bended knee, as we testify to your glory and love. Alleluia. Amen!
2025-04-12.doctrinal: Saul asked, “Who are you, Lord?” The Lord answered, “I am Jesus whom you are persecuting. But get up and stand on your feet, for I have appeared to you for this purpose, to appoint you to serve and testify to the things in which you have seen me and to those in which I will appear to you.” Acts 26:15-16
2025-04-12.daily_watchword: Joshua fell on his face to the earth and worshiped, and he said to him, “What do you command your servant, my lord?” Joshua 5:14

2025-04-13.prayer: Blessed Jesus, majestic and humble, you stir our hearts with divine love. Your sacrifice is immeasurable. Your triumphs ring pure. Grant us the courage to enter Jerusalem with you and bear our crosses each day. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-04-13.doctrinal: Let the same mind be in you that was in Christ Jesus. Philippians 2:5
2025-04-13.daily_watchword: You shall not cheat one another, but you shall fear your God. Leviticus 25:17
2025-04-13.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Let those who fear the Lord say, “His steadfast love endures forever.” Psalm 118:4

2025-04-14.prayer: Creator of heaven and earth, the bounties of your love are breathtaking and boundless! We thank you for nourishing and protecting us. May our life-long service wield wisely the gifts and blessings you have bestowed upon us. Amen.
2025-04-14.doctrinal: Barnabas and Paul said, “God has not left himself without a witness in doing good, giving you rains from heaven and fruitful seasons and filling you with food and your hearts with joy.” Acts 14:17
2025-04-14.daily_watchword: The earth is full of the steadfast love of the Lord. Psalm 33:5

2025-04-15.prayer: You who call us, we ask for true wisdom and purpose. Entrust us with your words of guidance and encouragement. Present us with a call, that, like Samuel, we might be quick to respond and swift to follow. Amen.
2025-04-15.doctrinal: Where is the one who is wise? Where is the scholar? Where is the debater of this age? Has not God made foolish the wisdom of the world? 1 Corinthians 1:20
2025-04-15.daily_watchword: Since the wise have rejected the word of the Lord, what wisdom is in them? Jeremiah 8:9

2025-04-16.prayer: Dear everlasting God, as we walk through Holy Week with Christ, we thank you for your willing and immeasurable sacrifice, your constant presence among us, and your ever- moving Holy Spirit. Unite us, the body of Christ, in your coming kingdom. Amen.
2025-04-16.doctrinal: For the perishable must clothe itself with the imperishable, and the mortal with immortality. 1 Corinthians 15:53 NIV
2025-04-16.daily_watchword: As for mortals, their days are like grass; they flourish like a flower of the field; for the wind passes over it, and it is gone. But the steadfast love of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting. Psalm 103:15-16,17

2025-04-17.prayer: Our Redeemer, you have invited us to your table, washed our feet with a loving and humble heart, and borne our burdens. Let us commit ourselves this day to be your strength. Let us take the cup of loving sacrifice and love one another as you have loved us. Amen.
2025-04-17.doctrinal: Jesus prayed, “Father, if you are willing, remove this cup from me, yet not my will but yours be done.” Then an angel from heaven appeared to him and gave him strength. Luke 22:42-43
2025-04-17.daily_watchword: Nevertheless, I am continually with you; you hold my right hand. Psalm 73:23
special_remarks: Watchword for Maundy Thursday — He has gained renown by his wonderful deeds; the Lord is gracious and merciful. Psalm 111:4

2025-04-18.prayer: Prince of peace, we confess our faith this day as we remember your last breaths, your cries of anguish, and the blood spilling from your side. Bless and comfort us, gracious God. Remember us as you go into your kingdom. Amen.
2025-04-18.doctrinal: In Christ, God was reconciling the world to himself, not counting their trespasses against them, and entrusting the message of reconciliation to us. 2 Corinthians 5:19
2025-04-18.daily_watchword: He is named Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace. Isaiah 9:6
special_remarks: Watchword for Good Friday — For God so loved the world that he gave his only son, so that everyone who believes in him may not perish but may have eternal life. John 3:16

2025-04-19.prayer: Hear us, holy Jesus. Hear our anxious chatter in the anticipation of rejoicing Easter morning. Be near us in our time of mourning, waiting, and expectation. Join us again in triumph and victory with your life-changing, divine love. Amen.
2025-04-19.doctrinal: He replied to the criminal, “Truly I tell you, today you will be with me in paradise.” Luke 23:43
2025-04-19.daily_watchword: The Lord has sent me to proclaim the year of the Lord’s favor and the day of vengeance of our God. Isaiah 61:1,2

2025-04-20.prayer: Risen Jesus, we shout from the mountaintops that you have risen indeed! With victory and divine mystery, you bring salvation and the possibility of peace and blessing for all. Hosanna in the highest! Triumphant alleluias, we sing. Amen.
2025-04-20.doctrinal: Jesus took with him Peter and John and James and went up on the mountain to pray. Luke 9:28
2025-04-20.daily_watchword: Hezekiah received the letter and read it; then Hezekiah went up to the house of the Lord and spread it before the Lord. 2 Kings 19:14
2025-04-20.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Why do you look for the living among the dead? Jesus is not here, but has risen. Luke 24:5

2025-04-21.prayer: Holy Three-in-One, your tranquil, shepherding voice rings in our hearts, calling us by name, because no one is a stranger to you. Thank you for seeking us, for your grand pardon, and for your continual presence and assurance. Amen.
2025-04-21.doctrinal: For us there is one God, the Father, from whom are all things and for whom we exist, and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom are all things and through whom we exist. 1 Corinthians 8:6
2025-04-21.daily_watchword: If you are returning to the Lord with all your heart, then put away the foreign gods from among you. 1 Samuel 7:3

2025-04-22.prayer: Blessed Jesus, you have risen from the tomb victoriously. Your love is boundless and undeniable. Accept our humble and contrite hearts. Renew us in spirit and guide us as your hands and feet on this earth. Amen.
2025-04-22.doctrinal: Christ himself bore our sins in his body on the cross, so that, having died to sins, we might live for righteousness. 1 Peter 2:24
2025-04-22.daily_watchword: All we like sheep have gone astray; we have all turned to our own way, and the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all. Isaiah 53:6

2025-04-23.prayer: Rock of Ages, we are forever grateful for your gifts of strength and endurance. Build your Church on our testimonies to your changeless love, the wounds and scars you bear for us, and the foundation of Christ, the cornerstone. Amen.
2025-04-23.doctrinal: Jesus said to Thomas, “Put your finger here and see my hands. Reach out your hand and put it in my side. Do not doubt but believe.” John 20:27
2025-04-23.daily_watchword: I am God Almighty; walk before me, and be blameless. Genesis 17:1

2025-04-24.prayer: Divine Healer, we are forever grateful for your presence among us, for the beauty of creation, and for our salvation. God, we need your healing. Lift up our neighbors in poverty and conflict, and let your boundless love reach every heart. Amen.
2025-04-24.doctrinal: They were astounded beyond measure, saying, “He has done everything well; he even makes the deaf to hear and the mute to speak.” Mark 7:37
2025-04-24.daily_watchword: My heart rejoices in your salvation. Psalm 13:5 NIV

2025-04-25.prayer: Most gracious Lord, hear our cries of pain and anguish, hear our pleas for peace. Deliver us, your servants, from the struggles we endure: those that remain unspoken in our hearts, and those visible in our communities. We need you, Lord. Amen.
2025-04-25.doctrinal: Paul, in chains, wrote: I know that through your prayers and God’s provision of the Spirit of Jesus Christ what has happened to me will turn out for my deliverance. Philippians 1:19 NIV
2025-04-25.daily_watchword: The Israelites said to Samuel, “Do not cease to cry out to the Lord our God for us, and pray that he may save us.” 1 Samuel 7:8

2025-04-26.prayer: Bountiful Lord, thank you for always providing. You have given us forgiveness, community, belonging, and our daily bread along the way. We rejoice, not in earthly riches, but in the divine love and grace from you that we share. Amen.
2025-04-26.doctrinal: We brought nothing into the world, so that we can take nothing out of it, but if we have food and clothing, we will be content with these. 1 Timothy 6:7-8
2025-04-26.daily_watchword: The lover of money will not be satisfied with money, nor the lover of wealth with gain. Ecclesiastes 5:10

2025-04-27.prayer: God, our strong salvation, though we are undeserving, you defend and deliver us. You seek us in the darkness and trouble we find. You heard our cries for mercy and gave your own son so that we may live. How great is our debt to you, O Lord. Amen.
2025-04-27.doctrinal: Jesus tells a parable, “The slave fell on his knees before him, saying, ‘Have patience with me, and I will pay you everything.’ And out of pity for him, the lord of that slave released him and forgave him the debt.” Matthew 18:26-27
2025-04-27.daily_watchword: I love the Lord because he has heard my voice and my supplications. Psalm 116:1
2025-04-27.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Jesus said, “Peace be with you. As the Father has sent me, so I send you.” John 20:21

2025-04-28.prayer: Omniscient God, guide of the blind, you know our hearts, our troubles, and our doubts. Grant us the faith and trust to take each subsequent step on the journey to everlasting life with you. Bless us with willing spirits and compassionate hearts to serve. Amen.
2025-04-28.doctrinal: Jesus asked the blind man, “What do you want me to do for you?” He said, “Lord, let me see again.” Jesus said to him, “Receive your sight; your faith has saved you.” Immediately he regained his sight and followed him, glorifying God. Luke 18:40-43
2025-04-28.daily_watchword: Make haste to help me, O Lord, my salvation. Psalm 38:22

2025-04-29.prayer: Lamb of God, our all in all, be among us today. Give us tender hearts and inspire us to go the extra mile for all the weak and weary in spirit. Be the rock we build upon. Mold us as examples of service and unconditional love. Amen.
2025-04-29.doctrinal: The Lord said, “When you have done all that you were ordered to do, say, ‘We are worthless slaves; we have done only what we ought to have done!’” Luke 17:10
2025-04-29.daily_watchword: It is a sin to despise one’s neighbor, but blessed is the one who is kind to the needy. Proverbs 14:21 NIV

2025-04-30.prayer: O Ancient of days, grant us the faith to accept the many mysteries we cannot understand. Give us the courage to seek answers in Christ and to follow in his example. Though we are feeble and our bodies temporal, we praise your sustaining and life-giving Spirit. Amen.
2025-04-30.doctrinal: God has made known to us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure that he set forth in Christ, as a plan for the fullness of time, to gather up all things in him, things in heaven and things on earth. Ephesians 1:9-10
2025-04-30.daily_watchword: Yours, O Lord, are the greatness, the power, the glory, the victory, and the majesty, for all that is in the heavens and on the earth is yours. 1 Chronicles 29:11

2025-05-01.prayer: Lord Jesus, may we take your model of humility as our example. We recognize that your way of truth and love leads each of us to God, to life eternal for the good of people and to the glory of God. Amen.
2025-05-01.doctrinal: Now when the centurion who stood facing him saw that in this way he breathed his last, he said, “Truly this man was God’s Son!” Mark 15:39
2025-05-01.daily_watchword: All his works are truth, and his ways are justice; he is able to bring low those who walk in pride. Daniel 4:37

2025-05-02.prayer: Faithful Father, God, we thank you for the assurances you give of your abiding love and care for us, and that you allow us to share your love and compassion with the world. Amen.
2025-05-02.doctrinal: Suddenly the heavens were opened to Jesus and he saw God’s Spirit descending like a dove and alighting on him. Matthew 3:16
2025-05-02.daily_watchword: I will not fail you or forsake you. Joshua 1:5

2025-05-03.prayer: Lord God, you know our hearts. Our impulses are not always pure. Forgive us, please. Make us aware of our falling short, so that none are lost, but all are found. Amen.
2025-05-03.doctrinal: In everything set them an example by doing what is good. In your teaching show integrity, seriousness and soundness of speech that cannot be condemned, so that those who oppose you may be ashamed because they have nothing bad to say about us. Titus 2:7-8 NIV
2025-05-03.daily_watchword: Lord, turn my heart to your decrees and not to selfish gain. Psalm 119:36

2025-05-04.prayer: Loving God, help us to recognize pride in our thoughts and willfulness in our actions. Let the strength and might you offer lead us gently to the world, where we may dwell safely and love our neighbors fully. Amen.
2025-05-04.doctrinal: Mary said, “He has performed mighty deeds with his arm; he has scattered those who are proud in their inmost thoughts.” Luke 1:51 NIV
2025-05-04.daily_watchword: The Lord is my strength and my might, and he has become my salvation. Exodus 15:2
2025-05-04.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Worthy is the Lamb that was slain to receive power and wealth and wisdom and might and honor and glory and blessing! Revelation 5:12

2025-05-05.prayer: Lord God, we know our grief and we know your greater compassion. We praise you. Amen.
2025-05-05.doctrinal: Zechariah asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John.” And all of them were amazed. Immediately his mouth was opened and his tongue freed, and he began to speak, praising God. Luke 1:63-64
2025-05-05.daily_watchword: The Lord will not reject forever. Although he causes grief, he will have compassion according to the abundance of his steadfast love. Lamentations 3:31-32

2025-05-06.prayer: Dearest Lord, bring us nearer to you. Let our beliefs be true and clear. Heal our misunderstandings and make us worthy to stand before you. Amen.
2025-05-06.doctrinal: Jesus said to Martha, “Did I not tell you that if you believed you would see the glory of God?” John 11:40
2025-05-06.daily_watchword: Hear, you who are far away, what I have done, and you who are near, acknowledge my might. Isaiah 33:13

2025-05-07.prayer: Creator God, where have we been? Where are we now—in life’s storms? Your voice calls us over the wind and the waves. Help us to trust you completely, to keep putting ourselves obediently forward. Amen.
2025-05-07.doctrinal: Jesus got up and rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a dead calm. They were amazed, saying, “What sort of man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him?” Matthew 8:26-27
2025-05-07.daily_watchword: The Lord answered Job, “Where were you when I laid the foundation of the earth; and said to the sea, “Thus far shall you come and no farther, and here shall your proud waves be stopped?” Job 38:4,11

2025-05-08.prayer: O God, let us recount your covenants and your greatest commandments and help us plot each day’s course by them. Fill our hearts, minds, and souls with love for you and our neighbors. Amen.
2025-05-08.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Do not think that I have come to abolish the law or the prophets; I have come not to abolish but to fulfill.” Matthew 5:17
2025-05-08.daily_watchword: God declared to you his covenant, which he charged you to observe, that is, the ten commandments, and he wrote them on two stone tablets. Deuteronomy 4:13

2025-05-09.prayer: O God, nurture in us the growth that comes from the study of your word and way. May we see the examples of the people of the Bible and learn from them. Increase our hunger for your presence. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-05-09.doctrinal: Is there injustice on God’s part? By no means! Romans 9:14
2025-05-09.daily_watchword: Yet your people say, “The way of the Lord is not just,” when it is their own way that is not just. Ezekiel 33:17

2025-05-10.prayer: Lord God, in the depths of our confusion, we strain to see your truth; we try to dodge pits and snares; falsehoods surround us. Raise our hearts and faces to see our Christ looking at us with his love, from his cross. Amen.
2025-05-10.doctrinal: At three o’clock Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?” which means, “My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?” Mark 15:34
2025-05-10.daily_watchword: “Am I only a God nearby,” declares the Lord, “and not a God far away?” Jeremiah 23:23 NIV

2025-05-11.prayer: All-knowing God, our theft is often not in the taking, but in withholding that which sustains another’s progress and station. We wrongly believe that what we have is ours, but only by your blessing are we blessed to bless another. Amen.
2025-05-11.doctrinal: Those who steal must give up stealing; rather, let them labor, doing good work with their own hands, so as to have something to share with the needy. Ephesians 4:28
2025-05-11.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Salvation belongs to our God who is seated on the throne, and to the lamb! Revelation 7:10

2025-05-12.prayer: Lord of our hearts, sustain us, we pray. Let our trust in you increase with each blessed encounter as we walk our daily walk with you. We may even bend and touch your hem in our awkwardness in your presence. We ask that your faith make us well. Thank you. Amen.
2025-05-12.doctrinal: Then suddenly a woman who had been suffering from a flow of blood for twelve years came up behind him and touched the fringe of his cloak, for she was saying to herself, “If I only touch his cloak, I will be made well.” Jesus turned, and seeing her he said, “Take heart, daughter; your faith has made you well.” And the woman was made well from that moment. Matthew 9:20-22
2025-05-12.daily_watchword: If you seek me with all your heart, I will let you find me, says the Lord. Jeremiah 29:13-14

2025-05-13.prayer: King of heaven, sovereign God, what greater treasure is there than to serve in your kingdom now, to be with you in the kingdom to come, with all the saints, basking in the light of your love? Help us work in your fields today. Amen.
2025-05-13.doctrinal: The kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field, which a man found and reburied; then in his joy he goes and sells all that he has and buys that field. Matthew 13:44
2025-05-13.daily_watchword: I rejoice at your word like one who finds great spoil. Psalm 119:162

2025-05-14.prayer: Triune God, you are our traveling companion, leading our journey into adventures of love, service, and spirituality. Help us follow your leading. Let us seek out new ways of loving you and others. Protect us. Amen.
2025-05-14.doctrinal: Paul said, “Last night there stood by me an angel of the God to whom I belong and whom I worship, and he said, ‘Do not be afraid, Paul; you must stand before the emperor, and, indeed, God has granted safety to all those who are sailing with you.’” Acts 27:23-24
2025-05-14.daily_watchword: If I take the wings of the morning and settle at the farthest limits of the sea, even there your hand shall lead me, and your right hand shall hold me fast. Psalm 139:9-10
