2025-05-15.prayer: Healing and merciful God, you see us as we truly are and lift our gaze to what we can be. Strengthen our resolve to walk in your way, looking neither left nor right, but keeping our eyes on you. Amen.
2025-05-15.doctrinal: Jesus said, “But the tax collector, standing far off, would not even lift up his eyes to heaven but was beating his breast and saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner!’ I tell you, this man went down to his home justified.” Luke 18:13-14
2025-05-15.daily_watchword: A broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise. Psalm 51:17

2025-05-16.prayer: Tender and merciful God, may we each, of all races, tribes, and nations, acknowledge the blessings we share with one another and worship you as the source of all things. May our behaviors and attitudes reflect our kinship in you. Amen.
2025-05-16.doctrinal: They are Israelites, and to them belong the adoption, the glory, the covenants, the giving of the law, the worship, and the promises. Romans 9:4
2025-05-16.daily_watchword: I will wait for the Lord, who is hiding his face from the house of Jacob. Isaiah 8:17

2025-05-17.prayer: Faithful God, steadfast is your love. Forgive our stumbling, faltering ways. Help us come to the finish line with our eyes on you. May our hearts be convinced of your love for us and our love for you. In Christ’s name, we pray. Amen.
2025-05-17.doctrinal: Because you have kept my word of endurance, I will keep you from the hour of trial that is coming on the whole world to test the inhabitants of the earth. Revelation 3:10
2025-05-17.daily_watchword: The steadfast love of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting on those who fear him, and his righteousness to children’s children, to those who keep his covenant. Psalm 103:17-18

2025-05-18.prayer: Almighty Lord and God, who do we think we are? Let us see ourselves for the fools that we are and return to you, cling to you and your word. We can be fools for you and wise in your ways. Amen.
2025-05-18.doctrinal: Do not deceive yourselves. If you think that you are wise in this age, you should become fools so that you may become wise. For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. 1 Corinthians 3:18-19
2025-05-18.daily_watchword: The Lord knows our thoughts, that they are but an empty breath. Psalm 94:11
2025-05-18.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Jesus said, “I am the Alpha and the Omega, the beginning and the end. To the thirsty I will give water as a gift from the spring of the water of life.” Revelation 21:6

2025-05-19.prayer: Christ, our conductor, our eyes and ears are open to the music of your world and the needs of our neighbors. We look to you. Direct us, keep us free from error as we speak of your love and peace. Amen.
2025-05-19.doctrinal: The Lord appointed seventy-two others and said, “Whatever house you enter, first say, ‘Peace to this house!’” Luke 10:1,5
2025-05-19.daily_watchword: We do not know what to do, but our eyes are on you. 2 Chronicles 20:12

2025-05-20.prayer: Ever-present Father and Son; you love us; you heal us; you forgive us, again and again. We do believe you and trust you, again and again, even though we sometimes fall away. Amen.
2025-05-20.doctrinal: The official said to him, “Sir, come down before my little boy dies.” Jesus said to him, “Go; your son will live.” The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him and started on his way. As he was going down, his slaves met him and told him that his child was alive. John 4:49-51
2025-05-20.daily_watchword: Thus said the Lord, “I have heard your prayer, I have seen your tears; indeed, I will heal you.” 2 Kings 20:5

2025-05-21.prayer: Lord God, who knows us all, we acknowledge that we know only a small part of ourselves and less of others. May we show to others the grace that you show to us. Strengthen us sojourners. Amen.
2025-05-21.doctrinal: Be merciful to those who doubt. Jude 22 NIV
2025-05-21.daily_watchword: Do not fear; Zion, let not your hands be weak. The Lord your God in your midst, the Mighty One, will save. Zephaniah 3:16-17 NKJV

2025-05-22.prayer: O God, we see them every day, on the street corners, in our schools and with their tents in the underbrush. Remind us that we are blessed to be a blessing. Help us discern what that might look like. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-05-22.doctrinal: The Canaanite woman knelt before Jesus, saying, “Lord, help me.” He answered, “It is not fair to take the children’s food and throw it to the dogs.” She said, “Yes, Lord, yet even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters’ table.” Then Jesus answered her, “Woman, great is your faith! Let it be done for you as you wish.” And her daughter was healed from that moment. Matthew 15:25-28
2025-05-22.daily_watchword: Do not let the downtrodden be put to shame. Psalm 74:21

2025-05-23.prayer: Caring God and Lord, you care so much for the world. May your love for us overflow as we share it among those we meet, for your love is never-ending. In your service, we pray. Amen.
2025-05-23.doctrinal: The owner of the house became angry and said to his slave, “Go out at once into the streets and lanes of the town and bring in the poor, the crippled, the blind, and the lame.” Luke 14:21
2025-05-23.daily_watchword: I am going to gather them from the farthest parts of the earth, among them the blind and the lame, those with child and those in labor together; a great company, they shall return here. Jeremiah 31:8

2025-05-24.prayer: Omniscient Lord, God, and Spiritus, creator of each of us, we are yours by your will if not our own. Give increase to our leanings to find you and to be found by you. May we be kind. Amen.
2025-05-24.doctrinal: When Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward him, he said of him, “Here is truly an Israelite in whom there is no deceit!” Nathanael asked him, “Where did you get to know me?” John 1:47-48
2025-05-24.daily_watchword: Only you know the human heart. 1 Kings 8:39

2025-05-25.prayer: God, from dust you made us; to dust we shall return, but before we do that, let us be all used up, doing all the good that we can do, so none are left hungry, homeless, or breathless. Faithfully working hands. Amen.
2025-05-25.doctrinal: What good is it, my brothers and sisters, if someone claims to have faith but does not have works? James 2:14
2025-05-25.daily_watchword: Do not be hard-hearted or tight-fisted toward your needy neighbor. Deuteronomy 15:7
2025-05-25.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Jesus said, “Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you.” John 14:27

2025-05-26.prayer: Spirit of God, fill us! Amen.
2025-05-26.doctrinal: The angel said to Mary, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you; therefore the child to be born will be holy; he will be called Son of God.” Luke 1:35
2025-05-26.daily_watchword: Not by might, nor by power, but by my spirit, says the Lord of hosts. Zechariah 4:6

2025-05-27.prayer: Our God and Savior, in perilous times and good, you are our life’s foundation and our hope. Bring us to that reality sooner rather than later. We are waiting for your return. Amen.
2025-05-27.doctrinal: Paul wrote: Indeed, we felt we had received the sentence of death. But this happened that we might not rely on ourselves but on God, who raises the dead. He has delivered us from such a deadly peril, and he will deliver us again. On him we have set our hope that he will continue to deliver us. 2 Corinthians 1:9-10 NIV
2025-05-27.daily_watchword: And who is a rock besides our God? Psalm 18:31

2025-05-28.prayer: Forgiving God and Lord, gird us to seek peace daily with our neighbors and those whom we see as foes—for whatever reason. Help us to offer the olive branch in our hands, and the love for you in our hearts. Amen.
2025-05-28.doctrinal: Pursue peace with everyone and the holiness without which no one will see the Lord. Hebrews 12:14
2025-05-28.daily_watchword: In days to come nation shall not lift up sword against nation; neither shall they learn war anymore. Isaiah 2:2,4

2025-05-29.prayer: Ascended Lord, we wait for your return, but we are not idle. Gift us with fearlessness and acts of love, proclaiming salvation through you and life eternal with you. Your kingdom come. Amen.
2025-05-29.doctrinal: Jesus said, “But if it is by the finger of God that I cast out the demons, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.” Luke 11:20
2025-05-29.daily_watchword: The Lord said, “I will grant peace in the land, and you shall lie down, and no one shall make you afraid.” Leviticus 26:6
special_remarks: Watchword for the Ascension — Jesus said, “I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.” John 12:32

2025-05-30.prayer: Lord Jesus, your name is exalted above all names. Like your apostles, help us teach and proclaim you as our savior everywhere, especially at home. Faith is the best gift we can offer to our children. Serving you. Amen.
2025-05-30.doctrinal: As the apostles left the council, they rejoiced that they were considered worthy to suffer dishonor for the sake of the name. And every day in the temple and at home they did not cease to teach and proclaim Jesus as the Messiah. Acts 5:41-42
2025-05-30.daily_watchword: Those who love your name may exult in you. Psalm 5:11

2025-05-31.prayer: Triune God, there is enough because you bless us. We now must use our blessings to do justice, love mercy, and walk humbly with our neighbor and with you. Amen.
2025-05-31.doctrinal: The rich are to do good, to be rich in good works, generous, and ready to share, thus storing up for themselves the treasure of a good foundation for the future, so that they may take hold of the life that really is life. 1 Timothy 6:18-19
2025-05-31.daily_watchword: It is well with those who deal generously and lend, who conduct their affairs with justice. Psalm 112:5

2025-06-01.prayer: Lord almighty, please look upon us, your servants, in our need and remember us. Shower us with your great mercy and grant us the desires of our hearts. May we, like Hanna and Elizabeth, give back to you all the days of our lives. Amen.
2025-06-01.doctrinal: Now the time came for Elizabeth to give birth, and she bore a son. Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown his great mercy to her, and they rejoiced with her. Luke 1:57-58
2025-06-01.daily_watchword: Hanna made a vow, saying, “Lord Almighty, if you will only look on your servant’s misery and remember me, and not forget your servant but give her a son, then I will give him to the Lord for all the days of his life.” 1 Samuel 1:11 NIV
2025-06-01.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Rejoice in the Lord, O you righteous, and give thanks to his holy name! Psalm 97:12
special_remarks: Ascension Sunday Seventh Sunday of Easter

2025-06-02.prayer: Gracious Healer, we are transformed by your presence and saved by your mercy and grace. Teach us to love. Renew our souls, so that we may rededicate ourselves to your service. Amen.
2025-06-02.doctrinal: Jesus said to Zacchaeus, “Today salvation has come to this house, because he, too, is a son of Abraham. For the son of man came to seek out and to save the lost.” Luke 19:9-10
2025-06-02.daily_watchword: Jeremiah said, “For the brokenness of the daughter of my people I am broken. Is there no balm in Gilead? Is there no physician there?” Jeremiah 8:21,22

2025-06-03.prayer: Most holy Lord of hosts, the whole earth is full of your glory. We stand in awe of your creation’s majesty and life- giving waters. Clothe us in your righteousness and grant us your peace. Amen.
2025-06-03.doctrinal: The angel said in a loud voice, “Fear God and give him glory, for the hour of his judgment has come, and worship him who made heaven and earth, the sea and the springs of water.” Revelation 14:7
2025-06-03.daily_watchword: Holy, holy, holy is the Lord of hosts; the whole earth is full of his glory. Isaiah 6:3

2025-06-04.prayer: Holy God of our salvation, we praise your holy name. Provide us with our daily bread, as we trust in your provision. We give thanks for your steadfast love and faithfulness. Amen.
2025-06-04.doctrinal: Give us today our daily bread. Matthew 6:11
2025-06-04.daily_watchword: You are my Father, my God, and the rock of my salvation! Psalm 89:26

2025-06-05.prayer: Savior God, we confess that we are a sinful people. When that spirit of sinfulness and despair overcomes us, we are truly thankful for the life of Christ that has set us free from the law of sin and death. Lead us now to repentance and forgiveness. Amen.
2025-06-05.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter the kingdom of heaven, but only the one who does the will of my Father in heaven.” Matthew 7:21
2025-06-05.daily_watchword: But to the wicked God said, “What right have you to recite my statutes or take my covenant on your lips? For you hate discipline, and you cast my words behind you.” Psalm 50:16-17

2025-06-06.prayer: God of all, whose love surrounds us, praise we bring you, joyfully! Protect us from evil, guide our steps, and keep us in your care, now and forever, as we live our lives in service to you. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-06-06.doctrinal: Jesus prayed, “I am not asking you to take them out of the world, but I ask you to protect them from the evil one.” John 17:15
2025-06-06.daily_watchword: As the mountains surround Jerusalem, so the Lord surrounds his people from this time on and forevermore. Psalm 125:2

2025-06-07.prayer: Gentle Shepherd, your power and might are always on display. Help us to remember that this power is funneled through your great love for us, and that you love us fiercely and powerfully as your chosen children. Amen.
2025-06-07.doctrinal: They drove Jesus out of the town and led him to the brow of the hill on which their town was built, so that they might hurl him off the cliff. But he passed through the midst of them and went on his way. Luke 4:29-30
2025-06-07.daily_watchword: O Lord, in your hand are power and might, so that no one is able to withstand you. 2 Chronicles 20:6

2025-06-08.prayer: Multitudes of heaven worship you, Lord, for you give life to everything. Fill us with the Holy Spirit and the boldness to speak your word as we gather together in prayer. May we experience your power and presence in our midst. Amen.
2025-06-08.doctrinal: When they had prayed, the place in which they were gathered together was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and spoke the word of God with boldness. Acts 4:31
2025-06-08.daily_watchword: Lord, you give life to everything, and the multitudes of heaven worship you. Nehemiah 9:6 NIV
2025-06-08.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — For all who are led by the Spirit of God are children of God. Romans 8:14

2025-06-09.prayer: Spirit of holiness, there are times when we dishonor your good intentions for us. You long to restore us to the image of God, but we let it tarnish as we nurse selfish attitudes. Burn away our impurities and forge us into useful instruments in your service. Until he comes. Amen.
2025-06-09.doctrinal: When they bring you to trial and hand you over, do not worry beforehand about what you are to say, but say whatever is given you at that time, for it is not you who speak but the Holy Spirit. Mark 13:11
2025-06-09.daily_watchword: Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but the Lord rescues them from them all. Psalm 34:19

2025-06-10.prayer: Lord, you are our rock, fortress, and deliverer. We ask that you stand by us and give us strength to proclaim your message to all people, just as you did for Paul. Rescue us from danger and guide us on your path. Amen.
2025-06-10.doctrinal: Paul wrote: The Lord stood by me and gave me strength, so that through me the message might be fully proclaimed, and all the gentiles might hear it. So, I was rescued from the lion’s mouth. 2 Timothy 4:17
2025-06-10.daily_watchword: The Lord is my rock, my fortress, and my deliverer. 2 Samuel 22:2

2025-06-11.prayer: Rock of our salvation, we are a tired and weary people. Our time and talents are often exhausted from pursuing our own goals instead of your will for our lives. Give us true rest and renewed strength so that we may be good stewards of your creation and faithful messengers of your saving grace. Amen.
2025-06-11.doctrinal: Jesus asked them, “Which is lawful on the Sabbath: to do good or to do evil, to save life or to kill?” Mark 3:4 NIV
2025-06-11.daily_watchword: Six days you shall labor and do all your work. But the seventh day is a Sabbath to the Lord your God; you shall not do any work. Exodus 20:9-10

2025-06-12.prayer: Holy Illuminator, we pray that we may reflect your truth and hope, mirroring your grace to guide and stay bright in darkness. Grant us courage to illuminate the path towards your eternal promise. Amen.
2025-06-12.doctrinal: You shine like stars in the world, holding forth the word of life. Philippians 2:15-16
2025-06-12.daily_watchword: The Lord your God you shall follow, him alone you shall fear, his commandments you shall keep, his voice you shall obey, him you shall serve, and to him you shall hold fast. Deuteronomy 13:4

2025-06-13.prayer: Spirit of holiness, nothing is too wonderful for you. We pray that you will fill us with faith and remove our stubbornness. Help us to believe and trust in you always. Amen.
2025-06-13.doctrinal: Later he appeared to the eleven themselves as they were sitting at the table, and he upbraided them for their lack of faith and stubbornness, because they had not believed those who saw him after he had risen. Mark 16:14
2025-06-13.daily_watchword: Is anything too wonderful for the Lord? Genesis 18:14

2025-06-14.prayer: Almighty God, may we see the good in your teachings and resist the temptations of the world that only bring temporary pleasure. Guide us to prioritize your will so that we may live in your love and grace forevermore. Amen.
2025-06-14.doctrinal: The world and its desire are passing away, but those who do the will of God abide forever. 1 John 2:17
2025-06-14.daily_watchword: The woman saw that the tree was good for food and that it was a delight to the eyes and that the tree was to be desired to make one wise. Genesis 3:6

2025-06-15.prayer: Savior of the world, teach us to follow your example and love as you have loved. Reveal yourself through your word and allow your Spirit that dwells within us to guide and comfort us. In the name of Jesus, we pray. Amen.
2025-06-15.doctrinal: The Lord’s servant must not be quarrelsome but kindly to everyone, an apt teacher, patient, correcting opponents with gentleness. God may perhaps grant that they will repent. 2 Timothy 2:24-25
2025-06-15.daily_watchword: Render true judgments, show kindness and mercy to one another. Zechariah 7:9
2025-06-15.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Since we are justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ. Romans 5:1

2025-06-16.prayer: Holy God, grant us the wisdom to respond to conflict with soft words, turning away wrath and promoting peace. Help us to hold fast to the sound teaching of Christ Jesus, living in faith and love, so that our words and actions may reflect your grace. Amen.
2025-06-16.doctrinal: Hold to the standard of sound teaching that you have heard from me, in the faith and love that are in Christ Jesus. 2 Timothy 1:13
2025-06-16.daily_watchword: A soft answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger. Proverbs 15:1

2025-06-17.prayer: God of our ancestors, do not let fear overcome us. Accompany us on our journey, as you did with Jacob, and bring us up again. As we follow you, may we be granted the promise of eternal life, as promised by your son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
2025-06-17.doctrinal: Peter said, “Look, we have left our homes and followed you.” And Jesus said to them, “Truly I tell you, there is no one who has left house or wife or brothers or parents or children for the sake of the kingdom of God who will not get back very much more in this age and in the age to come eternal life.” Luke 18:28-30
2025-06-17.daily_watchword: God said to Jacob, “I am God, the God of your father; do not be afraid. I myself will go down with you to Egypt, and I will also bring you up again.” Genesis 46:3-4

2025-06-18.prayer: Name above all names, may your words bring joy and delight to all who hear and follow them. We pray that we also may be baptized in your name and receive the Holy Spirit to guide us on our journey of faith. Amen.
2025-06-18.doctrinal: Philip and the eunuch went down into the water, and Philip baptized him. When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord snatched Philip away; the eunuch saw him no more and went on his way rejoicing. Acts 8:38-39
2025-06-18.daily_watchword: Your words became to me a joy and the delight of my heart, for I am called by your name, O Lord, God of hosts. Jeremiah 15:16

2025-06-19.prayer: Eternal God, we pray for our church as a witnessing fellowship for you. As you have always been faithful to us, help us to be faithful to you, shiny as beacons of light in our communities. In the name of Jesus, we pray. Amen.
2025-06-19.doctrinal: And this good news of the kingdom will be proclaimed throughout the world, as a testimony to all the nations, and then the end will come. Matthew 24:14
2025-06-19.daily_watchword: Thus said the Lord God, I will gather others to them besides those already gathered. Isaiah 56:8

2025-06-20.prayer: Merciful Savior, may we turn to you and be granted your gracious mercy. In our loneliness and affliction, we seek your comfort and strength to guide us in all things. Amen.
2025-06-20.doctrinal: Jesus, son of David, have mercy on me! Mark 10:47
2025-06-20.daily_watchword: Turn to me and be gracious to me, for I am lonely and afflicted. Psalm 25:16

2025-06-21.prayer: Lord, you are faithful, and your love endures forever. You continue to transform believers—healing, reconciling, and empowering. Lives are turned around. Following your example, help us to be your servants ministering to the sick and helpless around us. Amen.
2025-06-21.doctrinal: The crowds with one accord listened eagerly to what was said by Philip, hearing and seeing the signs that he did. So there was great joy in that city. Acts 8:6,8
2025-06-21.daily_watchword: O give thanks to the Lord of lords, who alone does great wonders, for his steadfast love endures forever. Psalm 136:3,4

2025-06-22.prayer: Holy God, may your presence go before us like a pillar of cloud by day and fire by night, leading us along the way. May we search the scriptures with hearts open to the testimony of your son, Jesus Christ, who offers us eternal life. Amen.
2025-06-22.doctrinal: Jesus said, “You search the scriptures because you think that in them you have eternal life, and it is they that testify on my behalf.” John 5:39
2025-06-22.daily_watchword: The Lord went in front of them in a pillar of cloud by day, to lead them along the way, and in a pillar of fire by night, to give them light. Exodus 13:21
2025-06-22.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — For dominion belongs to the Lord, and he rules over the nations. Psalm 22:28

2025-06-23.prayer: Lord, we pray that your compassion and goodness continue to be evident in all that you have made. May we be set free from the sins of this world and experience the freedom of your glory. Amen.
2025-06-23.doctrinal: The creation itself will be set free from its enslavement to decay and will obtain the freedom of the glory of the children of God. Romans 8:21
2025-06-23.daily_watchword: The Lord is good to all, and his compassion is over all that he has made. Psalm 145:9

2025-06-24.prayer: When we find ourselves in times of trouble, Lord, we find it hard to discern your plans for us. We take comfort knowing that you, the one true creator, grant us a future of hope. Let us hear your call, Lord. Amen.
2025-06-24.doctrinal: Jesus said to Peter, “Very truly, I tell you, when you were younger, you used to fasten your own belt and to go wherever you wished. But when you grow old, you will stretch out your hands, and someone else will fasten a belt around you and take you where you do not wish to go.” John 21:18
2025-06-24.daily_watchword: Trust in the Lord with all your heart, and do not rely on your own insight. In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make straight your paths. Proverbs 3:5-6

2025-06-25.prayer: God of all nations, we lament that we often create and worship our own kingdoms and temples here on earth. Grant that we may turn our talents and energies to your service until all have heard your name! Amen.
2025-06-25.doctrinal: All nations will come and worship before you, for your judgments have been revealed. Revelation 15:4
2025-06-25.daily_watchword: Those who are far off shall come and help to build the temple of the Lord. Zechariah 6:15

2025-06-26.prayer: Gracious Teacher, we give thanks for church leaders and mentors that have taught us about your word. We pray for our church to be a witnessing fellowship, shining as beacons of light in our communities for you. Amen.
2025-06-26.doctrinal: But as for you, continue in what you have learned and firmly believed, knowing from whom you learned it and how from childhood you have known sacred writings that are able to instruct you for salvation through faith in Christ Jesus. 2 Timothy 3:14-15
2025-06-26.daily_watchword: The Lord said to Moses, “Assemble the people for me, and I will let them hear my words, so that they may learn to fear me as long as they live on the earth and may teach their children so.” Deuteronomy 4:10

2025-06-27.prayer: Unchanging Anchor, you are Lord over all our lives. We pray that you grant us the strength to surrender to your will. May we always be yours and proclaim you as the risen Lord! Amen.
2025-06-27.doctrinal: If we live, we live to the Lord, and if we die, we die to the Lord; so then, whether we live or whether we die, we are the Lord’s. Romans 14:8
2025-06-27.daily_watchword: The Lord brings death and makes alive; he brings down to the grave and raises up. 1 Samuel 2:6 NIV

2025-06-28.prayer: Holy Redeemer, we are in awe of the life-changing healing and redemption only you can give. Abide in us as we go forth and share the good news to all in need of your miraculous grace. Amen.
2025-06-28.doctrinal: Jesus answered them, “Go and tell John what you hear and see: the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, those with a skin disease are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the poor have good news brought to them.” Matthew 11:4-5
2025-06-28.daily_watchword: With righteousness he shall judge for the poor and decide with equity for the oppressed of the earth. Isaiah 11:4

2025-06-29.prayer: God, we are assured by your word that your protection, guidance, and strength are with us always. As we venture into an uncertain world today, let us take comfort in the certainty we have with you. You truly are all we will ever need. Amen.
2025-06-29.doctrinal: Gamaliel said, “Keep away from these men and let them alone, because if this plan or this undertaking is of human origin, it will fail; but if it is of God, you will not be able to overthrow them.” Acts 5:38-39
2025-06-29.daily_watchword: The Lord frustrates the plans of the peoples. Psalm 33:10
2025-06-29.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — If we live by the Spirit, let us also be guided by the Spirit. Galatians 5:25

2025-06-30.prayer: Comforting Spirit, may those who are in misery and bitter in soul find comfort in your compassionate and merciful nature. We pray that you grant them the endurance of Job and the strength to persevere through their trials. May they trust in your plan and find hope in your light. Amen.
2025-06-30.doctrinal: You have heard of the endurance of Job, and you have seen the outcome that the Lord brought about, for the Lord is compassionate and merciful. James 5:11
2025-06-30.daily_watchword: Why is light given to one in misery and life to the bitter in soul, who long for death, but it does not come. Job 3:20-21

2025-07-01.prayer: Holy God, you know our desires, our strengths, our sacrifices, and our hearts better than we ever could. Knowing these things about us, you encourage us by opening doors and strengthening our hearts to serve you with joy and love. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-07-01.doctrinal: John wrote: These are the words of the Holy One, the true One, “I know your works. Look, I have set before you an open door that no one is able to shut. I know that you have but little power, yet you have kept my word and have not denied my name.” Revelation 3:7,8
2025-07-01.daily_watchword: My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever. Psalm 73:26

2025-07-02.prayer: Creator God, provide gentle correction and guidance when we stray toward selfishness, and help us to open our hearts and minds to selflessness instead. Help us to reflect your light outward toward others. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-07-02.doctrinal: Jesus spoke this parable, “The rich man said, ‘Soul, you have ample goods laid up for many years; relax, eat, drink, be merry.’ But God said to him, ‘You fool! This very night your life is being demanded of you. And the things you have prepared, whose will they be?’” Luke 12:19-20
2025-07-02.daily_watchword: Though the Lord is high, he regards the lowly, but the haughty he perceives from far away. Psalm 138:6

2025-07-03.prayer: Loving God, we pray that you would meet us wherever we are and lead us to act in ways that honor your love for us, each and every day. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-07-03.doctrinal: And whatever you do, in word or deed, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him. Colossians 3:17
2025-07-03.daily_watchword: The human mind plans the way, but the Lord directs the steps. Proverbs 16:9

2025-07-04.prayer: God of hope, you protect us and provide us with hope in a world in which it is a struggle to feel hopeful. Give us strength and courage to live our lives the best way we know how. Amen.
2025-07-04.doctrinal: This is indeed the will of my Father, that all who see the Son and believe in him may have eternal life, and I will raise them up on the last day. John 6:40
2025-07-04.daily_watchword: You are my hiding place and my shield; I hope in your word. Psalm 119:114

2025-07-05.prayer: God of awe and wonder, you sent your Son, Jesus Christ, to sacrifice himself for our sake. He takes away our guilt and shame and offers grace to every heart. Thank you for your gift to us. Amen.
2025-07-05.doctrinal: The woman said, “Come and see a man who told me everything I have ever done! He cannot be the Messiah, can he?” John 4:29
2025-07-05.daily_watchword: Look, O Lord, at how distressed I am; my heart is wrung within me because I have been very rebellious. Lamentations 1:20

2025-07-06.prayer: Alpha and Omega, when life presents us with challenges, we deal with them the best way we know how in the moment. Have mercy on us as we navigate the complexities and challenges of life. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-07-06.daily_watchword: Let the unrighteous forsake their thoughts; let them return to the Lord, that he may have mercy on them. Isaiah 55:7
2025-07-06.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — So let us not grow weary in doing what is right. Galatians 6:9

2025-07-07.prayer: Holy One, we are but humble servants, wandering through lives of faith, eager to speak your truths and share our love for you with others. Guide our wandering hearts, so we do not stray too far from you. Amen.
2025-07-07.doctrinal: Pray also for me, so that when I speak a message may be given to me to make known with boldness the mystery of the gospel, for which I am an ambassador in chains. Ephesians 6:19-20
2025-07-07.daily_watchword: The Lord remembered us in our low estate, for his steadfast love endures forever. Psalm 136:23

2025-07-08.prayer: Loving God, help us to be good stewards of the gifts we have received. Help us to care for ourselves, our families, our communities, and your world. Let us not forget that you have provided us with all that we have. Amen.
2025-07-08.doctrinal: Jesus prayed, “Righteous Father, the world does not know you, but I know you, and these know that you have sent me.” John 17:25
2025-07-08.daily_watchword: God reveals deep and hidden things. Daniel 2:22

2025-07-09.prayer: God of compassion, forgive us when we get distracted by the things of this world and fail to set our sights on you. Help us remember these things are fleeting and do not last, but your love is forever. Amen.
2025-07-09.doctrinal: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all, training us to renounce impiety and worldly passions and in the present age to live lives that are self-controlled, upright, and godly. Titus 2:11-12
2025-07-09.daily_watchword: Just as I have watched over them to pluck up and break down, so I will watch over them to build and to plant, said the Lord. Jeremiah 31:28

2025-07-10.prayer: God of justice, you have called us to serve others and to be concerned for justice for all people. We admit that this call can be overwhelming. Open doors and help us to see the path before us, that we may serve you as we are called to do. Amen.
2025-07-10.doctrinal: Jesus answered them, “Those who love me will keep my word, and my Father will love them, and we will come to them and make our home with them.” John 14:23
2025-07-10.daily_watchword: You shall keep my commandments and observe them: I am the Lord. Leviticus 22:31

2025-07-11.prayer: Light of the world, we take comfort in knowing that when our eyes are clouded by darkness and we cannot see a way forward, you illuminate our path. May we always know this truth in the deepest parts of our hearts. Amen.
2025-07-11.doctrinal: We know that, if the earthly tent we live in is destroyed, we have a building from God, a house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens. 2 Corinthians 5:1
2025-07-11.daily_watchword: When I think of your ordinances from of old, I take comfort, O Lord. Psalm 119:52

2025-07-12.prayer: Holy God, sometimes we need reassurance of your grace and mercy. Tune our hearts so that we might become more aware of your presence in our everyday lives. We ask all of this in your holy name. Amen.
2025-07-12.doctrinal: I tell you, now is the time of God’s favor, now is the day of salvation. 2 Corinthians 6:2 NIV
2025-07-12.daily_watchword: Thus said the Lord: In a time of favor I have answered you; on a day of salvation I have helped you. Isaiah 49:8

2025-07-13.prayer: O God, thank you for sending your son, Jesus, to save us and to show us how to love and offer grace to others. In the morning, in the evening, and all day long, we are reminded of your steadfast love for us. With gratitude, we pray. Amen.
2025-07-13.doctrinal: In the morning, while it was still very dark, Jesus got up and went out to a deserted place, and there he prayed. Mark 1:35
2025-07-13.daily_watchword: Lord my soul yearns for you in the night; in the morning my spirit longs for you. Isaiah 26:9 NIV
2025-07-13.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Make me to know your ways, O Lord; teach me your paths. Psalm 25:4

2025-07-14.prayer: Compassionate God, we often find ourselves slaves to our possessions, our money, our jobs, or our own wants, forgetting that these things are temporary. You are permanent, everlasting, and eternal. May we always remember this. Amen.
2025-07-14.doctrinal: My beloved, flee from the worship of idols. 1 Corinthians 10:14
2025-07-14.daily_watchword: But where are your gods that you made for yourself? Let them come, if they can save you, in your time of trouble. Jeremiah 2:28

2025-07-15.prayer: O God, one of the many joys of receiving your love is the opportunity to share it with others. In hope, we pray that you would help us find community, both within and outside the sacred spaces we call church. In your holy name, we pray. Amen.
2025-07-15.doctrinal: The hour is coming and is now here when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth. John 4:23
2025-07-15.daily_watchword: Solomon said, “Even heaven and the highest heaven cannot contain you, much less this house that I have built!” 1 Kings 8:27

2025-07-16.prayer: Loving God, sometimes we forget that those who lead us— in our churches, our local communities, and at the national level—need our prayers as they work to lead and guide diverse groups of people with diverse interests. Watch over them, too, Lord. Amen.
2025-07-16.doctrinal: I urge that prayers be made for kings and all who are in high positions, so that we may lead a quiet and peaceable life in all godliness and dignity. 1 Timothy 2:1-2
2025-07-16.daily_watchword: Unless the Lord guards the city, the guard keeps watch in vain. Psalm 127:1

2025-07-17.prayer: Healing God, too often we are paralyzed by feelings of unworthiness; too often, we are paralyzed by fear. In these moments, there is nothing left to do but ask for your healing strength. Heal us, O God, and make us whole. Amen.
2025-07-17.doctrinal: “So that you may know that the son of man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—Jesus said to the one who was paralyzed—“I say to you, stand up and take your stretcher and go to your home.” Immediately he stood up before them, took what he had been lying on, and went to his home, glorifying God. Luke 5:24-25
2025-07-17.daily_watchword: Heal me, O Lord, and I shall be healed; save me, and I shall be saved. Jeremiah 17:14

2025-07-18.prayer: God, your love for us burns so strong that you sent your son, Jesus, to heal and forgive. Help us to express radical love for one another as Jesus surrounds us with his love and grace. Amen.
2025-07-18.doctrinal: If anyone does sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous. 1 John 2:1
2025-07-18.daily_watchword: Our transgressions indeed are with us, and we know our iniquities: transgressing and denying the Lord. Isaiah 59:12-13

2025-07-19.prayer: God of justice, we often need to be reminded that those who hurt others are human, too. Our enemies deal with struggles and challenges just like we do, so help us remember to pray for their souls and the healing of their hearts. Amen.
2025-07-19.doctrinal: It is indeed just of God to repay with affliction those who afflict you and to give relief to the afflicted as well as to us, when the Lord Jesus is revealed from heaven. 2 Thessalonians 1:6-7
2025-07-19.daily_watchword: For God alone my soul waits in silence; from him comes my salvation. Psalm 62:1

2025-07-20.prayer: Immanuel—God with us—we long to feel and know your presence each and every day. Our hearts beat as one in Christian unity with so many others who love Christ as much as we do. Help us to share our love as your disciples, today and always. Amen.
2025-07-20.doctrinal: It was in Antioch that the disciples were first called “Christians.” Acts 11:26
2025-07-20.daily_watchword: Yet you, O Lord, are in the midst of us, and we are called by your name; do not forsake us! Jeremiah 14:9
2025-07-20.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Is anything too wonderful for the Lord? Genesis 18:14

2025-07-21.prayer: Holy One, we hope for the world to be at peace, but our eyes are not veiled to the realities of the world, either. At the very least, we pray for our own peace—free from anxiety, worry, or fear—knowing that we can always rest in you. Amen.
2025-07-21.doctrinal: You know the message he sent to the people of Israel, preaching peace by Jesus Christ—he is Lord of all. Acts 10:36
2025-07-21.daily_watchword: Peace, peace, to the far and the near, says the Lord, and I will heal them. Isaiah 57:19

2025-07-22.prayer: God, sometimes we stray, like sheep distracted by greener grass. We know that even when we stray, you never stop seeking us, and we always receive your grace. There is no shame in our humanity, and for that, we humble ourselves before you in gratitude. Amen.
2025-07-22.doctrinal: Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon son of John, do you love me?” He said to him, “Yes, Lord; you know that I love you.” Jesus said to him, “Tend my sheep.” John 21:16
2025-07-22.daily_watchword: Before I was humbled I went astray, but now I keep your word. Psalm 119:67

2025-07-23.prayer: Amazing God, you delight in us! Our imperfections aside, you genuinely love us just as we are, and you delight in meeting us where we are. We may be in the darkest recesses of our own hearts, or we may be frolicking in the fields of joy. Either way, your grace abounds! Amen.
2025-07-23.doctrinal: By the grace of God, I am what I am, and his grace toward me has not been in vain. 1 Corinthians 15:10
2025-07-23.daily_watchword: The Lord brought me out into a broad place; he delivered me because he delighted in me. Psalm 18:19

2025-07-24.prayer: Eternal God, there are times when we know we could have handled things better; times when we cry out for you in desperation and in hope. We pray that you would hear our cries, forgive us, and wrap us in your arms of comfort. Amen.
2025-07-24.doctrinal: A woman, who was a sinner, stood behind him at his feet, weeping, and began to bathe his feet with her tears and to dry them with her hair, kissing his feet and anointing them with the ointment. But Jesus said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you; go in peace.” Luke 7:37,38,50
2025-07-24.daily_watchword: Hear my prayer, Lord, listen to my cry for help; do not be deaf to my weeping. Psalm 39:12 NIV

2025-07-25.prayer: God of awe and wonder, we find ourselves amazed, that even after so many years, your word still strikes a chord in the song of our heart. We are grateful to those who came before us to share with us the good news of your love. We offer our thanks to you. Amen.
2025-07-25.doctrinal: For the time is coming when people will not put up with sound teaching, but, having their ears tickled, they will accumulate for themselves teachers to suit their own desires. 2 Timothy 4:3
2025-07-25.daily_watchword: We have heard with our ears, O God; our ancestors have told us what deeds you performed in their days, in the days of old. Psalm 44:1

2025-07-26.prayer: God of humility, it can be hard to admit that sometimes we have enough on our plate just trying to take care of ourselves in this life. When we feel the weight of the world on our shoulders, we pray you would help us carry our burdens. Amen.
2025-07-26.doctrinal: His master said to him, “Well done, good and trustworthy slave; you have been trustworthy in a few things; I will put you in charge of many things; enter into the joy of your master.” Matthew 25:21
2025-07-26.daily_watchword: I will punish you according to the fruit of your doings, said the Lord. Jeremiah 21:14

2025-07-27.prayer: God, we are stronger together than we are on our own. Help us to be in harmonious community with one another, encouraging and supporting each other, so that we can do the work you have called us to do. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-07-27.doctrinal: God did not give us a spirit of cowardice but rather a spirit of power and of love and of self-discipline. 2 Timothy 1:7
2025-07-27.daily_watchword: The Lord gives strength to his people. Psalm 29:11 NIV
2025-07-27.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Lord, teach us to pray. Luke 11:1

2025-07-28.prayer: Loving God, your son, Jesus, taught us how to pray, but that was merely the beginning. Guide us into deeper conversations with you through prayer, helping us strengthen our relationship with you. In your holy name, we pray. Amen.
2025-07-28.doctrinal: Our Father in heaven, hallowed be your name. Matthew 6:9 NIV
2025-07-28.daily_watchword: You shall not make wrongful use of the name of the Lord your God, for the Lord will not acquit anyone who misuses his name. Exodus 20:7

2025-07-29.prayer: God of beauty, we sing to you the songs that are in our hearts—the songs of joy, and of grief, and of sorrow. As we sing, we praise your glory, and our hearts fill with love and joy. Amen.
2025-07-29.doctrinal: Now as Jesus was approaching the path down from the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to praise God joyfully with a loud voice for all the deeds of power that they had seen. Luke 19:37
2025-07-29.daily_watchword: Be exalted, O Lord, in your strength! We will sing and praise your power. Psalm 21:13

2025-07-30.prayer: Merciful God, when we hear you call us, we admit that we are often afraid to follow you. Giving up our worldly comforts is not an easy ask, and yet, our hearts long for more than the things of this world. Help us to listen when you call. Amen.
2025-07-30.doctrinal: The young man said to Jesus, “I have kept all these; what do I still lack?” Matthew 19:20
2025-07-30.daily_watchword: Keep my commandments and live; keep my teachings as the apple of your eye. Proverbs 7:2

2025-07-31.prayer: Holy God, your love for us truly is steadfast—there is no doubt about that. The more we falter, the more mistakes we make, the more grace we receive. For this, we are eternally grateful. In your glorious name, we pray. Amen.
2025-07-31.doctrinal: Where sin increased, grace abounded all the more, so that, just as sin reigned in death, so grace might also reign through justification leading to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord. Romans 5:20-21
2025-07-31.daily_watchword: For as the heavens are high above the earth, so great is his steadfast love toward those who fear him. Psalm 103:11

2025-08-01.prayer: Dear divine Creator, grant us the strength to endure life’s trials, the wisdom to navigate challenges, and the courage to face uncertainty. May hope be our guiding light, illuminating our path with resilience and optimism. Amen.
2025-08-01.doctrinal: God gave us eternal life, and this life is in his son. 1 John 5:11
2025-08-01.daily_watchword: Is it not you, O Lord our God? We set our hope on you. Jeremiah 14:22

2025-08-02.prayer: Gracious God, inspire us to embody the profound command of Christ: to love one another selflessly. May our hearts overflow with compassion, kindness, and understanding, fostering a world united in the bond of love. Amen.
2025-08-02.doctrinal: Finally, all of you, have unity of spirit, sympathy, love for one another, a tender heart, and a humble mind. 1 Peter 3:8
2025-08-02.daily_watchword: Do not devise evil in your hearts against one another. Zechariah 7:10

2025-08-03.prayer: God, grant us strength to follow your path with unwavering faith. Illuminate our way with wisdom, kindness, and courage. May our actions reflect our intentions, and may we walk with grace and purpose. In Jesus’ name, we pray. Amen.
2025-08-03.daily_watchword: The Lord said, “I will instruct you and teach you the way you should go.” Psalm 32:8
2025-08-03.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Set your minds on things that are above, not on things that are on earth. Colossians 3:2

2025-08-04.prayer: Gracious God, thank you for your boundless generosity. Help us to embrace your abundance with gratitude and share it with others. May your lavish care inspire us to be vessels of love and kindness. Amen.
2025-08-04.doctrinal: If any of you is lacking in wisdom, ask God, who gives to all generously and ungrudgingly, and it will be given you. James 1:5
2025-08-04.daily_watchword: The Lord is a God of justice; blessed are all those who wait for him. Isaiah 30:18

2025-08-05.prayer: Lord, empower us to proclaim your word with conviction and clarity. Guide our tongues to speak truth boldly and our hearts to embody your teachings. May our words inspire faith and transformation in those we meet. Amen.
2025-08-05.doctrinal: Proclaim the message; be persistent whether the time is favorable or unfavorable; convince, rebuke, and encourage with the utmost patience in teaching. 2 Timothy 4:2
2025-08-05.daily_watchword: The Lord said to Moses, “You shall speak all that I command you.” Exodus 7:1,2

2025-08-06.prayer: Heavenly King, we lift our voices in joyful praise! You are worthy of all honor and glory! May our songs of adoration resound, echoing your majesty throughout the earth! Amen.
2025-08-06.doctrinal: I will pray with the spirit, but I will pray with the mind also; I will sing praise with the spirit, but I will sing praise with the mind also. 1 Corinthians 14:15
2025-08-06.daily_watchword: I will sing to the Lord, for he is highly exalted. Exodus 15:1 NIV

2025-08-07.prayer: Forgiving Lord, as we repent of our sins, grant us the strength to amend our ways. Help us turn back to you with sincere hearts, seeking your mercy and guidance. Amen.
2025-08-07.doctrinal: Jesus said, “But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and herbs of all kinds and neglect justice and the love of God; it is these you ought to have practiced, without neglecting the others.” Luke 11:42
2025-08-07.daily_watchword: You have looked for much, but it came to little, and when you brought it home, I blew it away. Why? Says the Lord of hosts. Because my house lies in ruins, while all of you hurry off to your own houses. Haggai 1:9

2025-08-08.prayer: Grant us, O Lord, the wisdom to restrain our tongues. Help us speak with kindness, truth, and love, refraining from words that shame or demean. Let our speech reflect your grace. Amen.
2025-08-08.doctrinal: From the same mouth comes a blessing and a curse. My brothers and sisters, this ought not to be so. James 3:10
2025-08-08.daily_watchword: I said, “I will guard my ways that I may not sin with my tongue.” Psalm 39:1

2025-08-09.prayer: God, when we stray, guide us back to your loving embrace. Grant us the courage to repent, the strength to seek forgiveness, and the humility to return to your divine presence. This we pray in the name of your son, Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
2025-08-09.doctrinal: Paul said, “I have not hesitated to preach anything that would be helpful to you. I have declared to both Jews and Greeks that they must turn to God in repentance and have faith in our Lord Jesus.” Acts 20:20-21 NIV
2025-08-09.daily_watchword: Put away the foreign gods that are among you and incline your hearts to the Lord. Joshua 24:23

2025-08-10.prayer: Eternal God, in your steadfastness, we find refuge. Amidst life’s storms, anchor us in your unwavering love. Grant us strength to trust in your promises, knowing you are faithful forever. Amen.
2025-08-10.doctrinal: And remember, I am with you always, to the end of the age. Matthew 28:20
2025-08-10.daily_watchword: The Lord bless you and keep you. Numbers 6:24
2025-08-10.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Jesus said, “Do not be afraid, little flock, for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom.” Luke 12:32

2025-08-11.prayer: Divine Savior, hear our cry for salvation. Rescue us from darkness; redeem us from sin. May your mercy embrace us, and your grace transform us. In your love, we find eternal life. Amen.
2025-08-11.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Beware that you are not led astray, for many will come in my name and say, ‘I am he!’ and, ‘The time is near!’ Do not go after them.” Luke 21:8
2025-08-11.daily_watchword: Everyone who calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved. Joel 2:32

2025-08-12.prayer: Lord Jesus, conqueror of death, you triumphed over the grave, offering us eternal life. Grant us faith in your victory, that we may fearlessly face death and rejoice in resurrection. Amen.
2025-08-12.doctrinal: Jesus said to them, “Thus it is written, that the Messiah is to suffer and to rise from the dead on the third day.” Luke 24:46
2025-08-12.daily_watchword: The Lord lives! Blessed be my rock. Psalm 18:46

2025-08-13.prayer: Divine Source of truth, enlighten our minds and hearts, as you did that day in Herrnhut. Grant us the courage to seek and uphold truth in all aspects of life. May your truth guide our paths. Amen.
2025-08-13.doctrinal: Those who do what is true come to the light, so that it may be clearly seen that their deeds have been done in God. John 3:21
2025-08-13.daily_watchword: God’s truth shall be your shield and buckler. Psalm 91:4 NKJV

2025-08-14.prayer: Heavenly Father, shower us with your boundless grace and forgiveness. May we humbly accept your mercy, letting it cleanse and renew our souls. May the act of your forgiveness remind us to forgive others, too. Amen.
2025-08-14.doctrinal: Whenever you stand praying, forgive, if you have anything against anyone, so that your Father in heaven may also forgive you your trespasses. Mark 11:25
2025-08-14.daily_watchword: The Lord said, “I do forgive, just as you have asked.” Numbers 14:20

2025-08-15.prayer: Divine Creator, pour out your abundant blessings upon us. Guide our steps, illuminate our paths, and fill our hearts with gratitude. May your blessings overflow, touching every aspect of our lives. Amen.
2025-08-15.doctrinal: All the people saw the one [who had been healed,] walking and praising God. Acts 3:9
2025-08-15.daily_watchword: I will bless you as long as I live; I will lift up my hands and call on your name. Psalm 63:4

2025-08-16.prayer: Gracious God, draw us back to your loving embrace. May we abandon lives that rely on our own strengths and ideas, and may we find the courage to return to you with contrite hearts. Amen.
2025-08-16.doctrinal: When Judas, his betrayer, saw that Jesus was condemned, he repented and brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and the elders. He said, “I have sinned by betraying innocent blood.” Matthew 27:3-4
2025-08-16.daily_watchword: If you do what is right, will you not be accepted? But if you do not do what is right, sin is crouching at your door; it desires to have you, but you must rule over it. Genesis 4:7 NIV

2025-08-17.prayer: Eternal God, all praise belongs to you. With hearts overflowing, we lift our voices in adoration. May every breath we breathe proclaim your greatness, and every moment reflect your glory. Amen.
2025-08-17.doctrinal: I want to know Christ and the power of his resurrection. Philippians 3:10
2025-08-17.daily_watchword: Our days may come to seventy years, or eighty, if our strength endures; yet the best of them are but trouble and sorrow, for they quickly pass, and we fly away. Psalm 90:10 NIV
2025-08-17.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Let us run with perseverance the race that is set before us, looking to Jesus the pioneer and perfecter of our faith. Hebrews 12:2

2025-08-18.prayer: Lord, make us bold witnesses in the world. Guide our words and deeds to reflect your love and truth. May our lives draw others to you and glorify your name. Amen.
2025-08-18.doctrinal: Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit and teaching them to obey everything that I have commanded you. Matthew 28:19-20
2025-08-18.daily_watchword: Make known his deeds among the nations; proclaim that his name is exalted. Isaiah 12:4

2025-08-19.prayer: Lord of lords, bring us to the New Jerusalem. Let your kingdom come, where tears are wiped away, and joy reigns forever. Prepare our hearts for eternal communion with you. Amen.
2025-08-19.doctrinal: When the complete comes, the partial will come to an end. 1 Corinthians 13:10
2025-08-19.daily_watchword: The heavens will vanish like smoke, the earth will wear out like a garment, and those who live on it will die like gnats, but my salvation will be forever. Isaiah 51:6

2025-08-20.prayer: God of everlasting life, grant us the gift of eternity with you. May we live in your love, knowing that death is not the end but a passage to your eternal embrace. Amen.
2025-08-20.doctrinal: Store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust consumes and where thieves do not break in and steal. For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also. Matthew 6:20-21
2025-08-20.daily_watchword: Human beings are all like a puff of breath; great and small alike are worthless. Put them on the scales, and they weigh nothing; they are lighter than a mere breath. Psalm 62:9 GNT

2025-08-21.prayer: God, our time in this flesh is brief and often difficult. Help us cherish each moment, seeking your will above all. May our lives glorify you, even in our fleeting time. Amen.
2025-08-21.doctrinal: If you sow to your own flesh, you will reap corruption from the flesh, but if you sow to the Spirit, you will reap eternal life from the Spirit. Galatians 6:8
2025-08-21.daily_watchword: God said, “By the sweat of your face you shall eat bread until you return to the ground, for out of it you were taken; you are dust, and to dust you shall return.” Genesis 3:19

2025-08-22.prayer: Lord, may our lives satisfy you. Guide our intentions, actions, and desires to align with your divine will. Let our existence be a pleasing offering unto you. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-08-22.doctrinal: Try to find out what is pleasing to the Lord. Ephesians 5:10
2025-08-22.daily_watchword: Take care what you do, for there is no perversion of justice with the Lord our God or partiality or taking of bribes. 2 Chronicles 19:7

2025-08-23.prayer: Lord, forgive our transgressions. Grant us the strength to forgive those who have wronged us. May forgiveness be a path to healing and reconciliation in our lives. Amen.
2025-08-23.doctrinal: Jesus answered them, “My Father is still working, and I also am working.” John 5:17
2025-08-23.daily_watchword: You have burdened me with your sins; you have wearied me with your iniquities. I alone am the one who blots out your transgressions for my own sake, and I will not remember your sins. Isaiah 43:24-25

2025-08-24.prayer: Lord Jesus, our shepherd, guide us through life’s valleys and pastures. May we follow your voice, find rest in your care, and walk in your light forevermore. Amen.
2025-08-24.doctrinal: Jesus said, “I am the good shepherd. I know my own, and my own know me.” John 10:14
2025-08-24.daily_watchword: We, your people, the flock of your pasture, will give thanks to you forever; from generation to generation we will recount your praise. Psalm 79:13
2025-08-24.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — The steadfast love of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting on those who fear him. Psalm 103:17

2025-08-25.prayer: Gracious God, teach us to pray aright. Grant us humility, sincerity, and faith as we come before you. May our prayers align with your will and bring glory to your name. Amen.
2025-08-25.doctrinal: You ask and do not receive because you ask wrongly, in order to spend what you get on your pleasures. James 4:3
2025-08-25.daily_watchword: If you obey the Lord your God: Blessed shall you be in the city, and blessed shall you be in the field.” Deuteronomy 28:2-3

2025-08-26.prayer: God, our refuge in times of trouble, shelter us under your wings. Grant us peace and strength as we rest in your protective embrace. Amen.
2025-08-26.doctrinal: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. Philemon 3
2025-08-26.daily_watchword: The Lord is your keeper; the Lord is your shade at your right hand. The sun shall not strike you by day nor the moon by night. Psalm 121:5-6

2025-08-27.prayer: Merciful God, in your wisdom, rebuke us gently. Guide us on the path of righteousness. May your admonitions lead us to growth and deeper understanding of your love. Amen.
2025-08-27.doctrinal: The father said to the elder son, “But we had to celebrate and rejoice, because this brother of yours was dead and has come to life; he was lost and has been found.” Luke 15:32
2025-08-27.daily_watchword: The Lord reproves the one he loves, as a father the son in whom he delights. Proverbs 3:12

2025-08-28.prayer: God, teach us humility. May we see ourselves as we truly are and others as they can become. Guide us to serve with compassion and grace. Amen.
2025-08-28.doctrinal: Jesus said, “When you are invited, go and sit down at the lowest place, so that when your host comes, he may say to you, ‘Friend, move up higher’; then you will be honored in the presence of all who sit at the table with you.” Luke 14:10
2025-08-28.daily_watchword: You shall be a beautiful crown in the hand of the Lord and a royal diadem in the hand of your God. Isaiah 62:3

2025-08-29.prayer: Creator of all, inspire us with your divine wisdom. Help us to recognize your presence in every aspect of existence and to live in accordance with your divine will. Amen.
2025-08-29.doctrinal: All things came into being through him, and without him not one thing came into being. John 1:3
2025-08-29.daily_watchword: O Lord of hosts, you are God, you alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth; you have made heaven and earth. Isaiah 37:16

2025-08-30.prayer: Lord, bring healing to our bodies, minds, and spirits. Grant strength to the weary, comfort to the afflicted, and hope to the discouraged. May your divine touch restore wholeness to us all. Amen.
2025-08-30.doctrinal: It so happened that the father of Publius lay sick in bed with fever and dysentery. Paul visited him and cured him by praying and putting his hands on him. Acts 28:8
2025-08-30.daily_watchword: O, restore me to health and make me live! Isaiah 38:16

2025-08-31.prayer: God, infuse our service with delight. May we find fulfillment in serving others, and may we reflect your love through our actions. Let our service be a source of joy and blessing. Amen.
2025-08-31.doctrinal: In Christ Jesus we have access in boldness and confidence through faith in him. Ephesians 3:12
2025-08-31.daily_watchword: Happy are all who take refuge in him. Psalm 2:12
2025-08-31.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Let mutual love continue. Hebrews 13:1

2025-09-01.prayer: Lord, we are eternally thankful for the love you have shown us. We are reminded of it when we see our peers, friends, and family. Our differing world views can make love difficult, and that is why we pray for patience. Amen.
2025-09-01.doctrinal: Let us not give up the habit of meeting together, as some are doing. Instead, let us encourage one another all the more, since you see that the Day of the Lord is coming nearer. Hebrews 10:25 GNT
2025-09-01.daily_watchword: Hold fast to the Lord your God, as you have done to this day. Joshua 23:8

2025-09-02.prayer: Gracious God, we strive to welcome others the way you do. When we were homeless and in need, you took us in. When we find others that are homeless and in need, help us welcome them with the same warmth you have shown us. Amen.
2025-09-02.doctrinal: When Lydia and her household were baptized, she urged us, saying, “If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord, come and stay at my home.” Acts 16:15
2025-09-02.daily_watchword: Who am I, O Lord God, and what is my house, that you have brought me thus far? 2 Samuel 7:18

2025-09-03.prayer: O God, allow us to really listen; to feel the Holy Spirit; to observe your love; to make love a part of everyday life; to share love with all; to try and love like you. To you, we pray. Amen.
2025-09-03.doctrinal: Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you, so that you may be children of your Father in heaven. Matthew 5:44-45
2025-09-03.daily_watchword: A new heart I will give you, and a new spirit I will put within you. Ezekiel 36:26

2025-09-04.prayer: So often we try to solve the world’s problems on our own, dear God. When we fail, it is without you. When we succeed, it is because of you. It is a blessing that you only require repentance—and salvation will be given to those who believe. Thank you. Amen.
2025-09-04.doctrinal: The gospel is God’s saving power for everyone who believes. Romans 1:16
2025-09-04.daily_watchword: God will help you, the Almighty will bless you. Genesis 49:25

2025-09-05.prayer: Lord, too often we stray from you. The world has myriad distractions to take us off course. Your word is like a map providing us guidance to find our way home. May we follow where you lead. Amen!
2025-09-05.doctrinal: They exchanged the truth about God for a lie and worshiped and served the creature rather than the Creator, who is blessed forever! Romans 1:25
2025-09-05.daily_watchword: Never take your word of truth from my mouth. Psalm 119:43 NIV

2025-09-06.prayer: Heavenly Father, we are thankful for all you provide: for the food on our table and the friends at our door; for the ground beneath our feet and the air that we breath. We are thankful, heavenly Father. Amen.
2025-09-06.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Therefore do not worry, saying, ‘What will we eat?’ or ‘What will we drink?’ or ‘What will we wear?’ Indeed, your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.” Matthew 6:31,32
2025-09-06.daily_watchword: God said, “I will be like the dew to Israel; he shall blossom like the lily.” Hosea 14:5

2025-09-07.prayer: Today we sing your praises, O Lord. A chorus of humanity joyfully praises your name: the shy person in the back of church praises your name; the squeaky alto in the choir praises your name. Everyone knows the blessing you bring. May we remember to always sing your praises. Amen.
2025-09-07.doctrinal: When Jesus laid his hands on her, immediately she stood up straight and began praising God. Luke 13:13
2025-09-07.daily_watchword: With my mouth I will give great thanks to the Lord; I will praise him in the midst of the throng. Psalm 109:30
2025-09-07.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Choose life so that you and your descendants may live, loving the Lord your God, obeying him, and holding fast to him. Deuteronomy 30:19,20

2025-09-08.prayer: Holy Spirit, we are steadfast in our faith because of the calm you bring. Guide us and be gentle with us so that we may enjoy your peace and love. Through you, we pray. Amen.
2025-09-08.doctrinal: The fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, generosity, faithfulness, gentleness, and self-control. Galatians 5:22-23
2025-09-08.daily_watchword: God will send forth his steadfast love and his faithfulness. Psalm 57:3

2025-09-09.prayer: We are made in your image, God, but that image is blurred. We try our best to live our lives in your likeness, but we don’t see the full picture. We are blessed by your grace, and in turn, we paint your picture. To you, we pray. Amen.
2025-09-09.doctrinal: The apostles praised God, saying, “Then God has given even to the Gentiles the repentance that leads to life.” Acts 11:18
2025-09-09.daily_watchword: It has pleased the Lord to make you a people for himself. 1 Samuel 12:22

2025-09-10.prayer: Creator, we find comfort in your eternity. We face daily hardships as we continue to walk the path of life. May we persevere in all that we do, and when we reach the end, you will be patiently waiting for each of us. Amen.
2025-09-10.doctrinal: I am convinced that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor rulers, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers, nor height, nor depth, nor anything else in all creation will be able to separate us from the love of God in Christ Jesus our Lord. Romans 8:38-39
2025-09-10.daily_watchword: Our God—the great and mighty and awesome God, keeping covenant and steadfast love—do not treat lightly all the hardship that has come upon us. Nehemiah 9:32

2025-09-11.prayer: All nations can be blessed only through you, Lord. When we live together, we learn to love in your image. May we always remember that when we love together, we are neither Jew nor Gentile, but children of the Lord. Amen.
2025-09-11.doctrinal: Scripture foresaw that God would justify the Gentiles by faith and announced the gospel in advance to Abraham: “All nations will be blessed through you.” Galatians 3:8 NIV
2025-09-11.daily_watchword: I the Lord will speak the word that I speak, and it will be fulfilled. It will no longer be delayed. Ezekiel 12:25

2025-09-12.prayer: God, when you appear, it can be frightening, confusing, or overwhelming. But then, you comfort us and tell us, “Do not be afraid.” We pray that it is that simple. Amen.
2025-09-12.doctrinal: When the disciples saw Jesus walking on the sea, they were terrified, saying, “It is a ghost!” And they cried out in fear. But immediately Jesus spoke to them and said, “Take heart, it is I; do not be afraid.” Matthew 14:26-27
2025-09-12.daily_watchword: Do not be afraid of sudden terror, for the Lord will be your confidence. Proverbs 3:25,26 NKJV

2025-09-13.prayer: In you, O God, we place our trust. We trust that you will guide us to salvation, like a shepherd guides his sheep home. May we always remember to turn to you in prayer. Amen.
2025-09-13.doctrinal: Meanwhile the church throughout Judea, Galilee, and Samaria had peace and was built up. Living in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, it increased in numbers. Acts 9:31
2025-09-13.daily_watchword: In God I trust; I am not afraid. What can a mere mortal do to me? Psalm 56:11

2025-09-14.prayer: Father, we long to feel your warm embrace. In a world filled with misunderstanding and hate, we seek love and compassion. When we embrace you, it brings cause to celebrate and rejoice. Thank you. Amen.
2025-09-14.doctrinal: While the son was still far off, his father saw him and was filled with compassion; he ran and put his arms around him and kissed him. Luke 15:20
2025-09-14.daily_watchword: I will rejoice in the Lord; I will exult in the God of my salvation. Habakkuk 3:18
2025-09-14.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — The sacrifice acceptable to God is a broken spirit; a broken and contrite heart, O God, you will not despise. Psalm 51:17

2025-09-15.prayer: Great Teacher, we confess that we aren’t always listening. Sometimes we aren’t paying attention. At other times, we are oblivious to your word. We ask for forgiveness and guidance, so we may listen to you. Amen.
2025-09-15.doctrinal: Many who heard him were astounded. They said, “Is not this the carpenter?” Mark 6:2,3
2025-09-15.daily_watchword: I will raise up for them a prophet like you from among their fellow Israelites, and I will put my words in his mouth. Deuteronomy 18:18 NIV

2025-09-16.prayer: Jesus, we place our faith in you. We listen and hear the heavens proclaim your glory. We follow you without being able to see you. May our faith be moved by the Holy Spirit. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-09-16.doctrinal: Glorify God in your body. 1 Corinthians 6:20
2025-09-16.daily_watchword: The heavens are telling the glory of God. Psalm 19:1

2025-09-17.prayer: O holy One, we declare our faith in you. When times are difficult, we try not to falter, and take comfort in the good news of your salvation. Your steadfast faith in us does not go unnoticed, and we thank you for your continued patience. Amen.
2025-09-17.doctrinal: Pray for us as well, that God will open to us a door for the word, that we may declare the mystery of Christ, for which I am in prison, so that I may reveal it clearly, as I should. Colossians 4:3-4
2025-09-17.daily_watchword: Jeremiah said, “If I say, ‘I will not mention him or speak any more in his name,’ then within me there is something like a burning fire.” Jeremiah 20:9

2025-09-18.prayer: Lord of all creation, there is nothing that is of this world that we can offer to you. Our greatest riches are but a drop in the sea to you, but we can offer you ourselves, our devotion, and our faith. We humbly give what we can. Amen.
2025-09-18.doctrinal: Jesus said, “The widow out of her poverty has put in everything she had, all she had to live on.” Mark 12:44
2025-09-18.daily_watchword: The Lord said, “Why do you spend your money for that which is not bread and your earnings for that which does not satisfy? Listen carefully to me, and eat what is good.” Isaiah 55:2

2025-09-19.prayer: Lord, our roots grow deep in your love. May that love help us bring forth growth and new life in your church, and bear fruit in your world. In your eternal wisdom, we trust. Amen.
2025-09-19.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Abide in me as I abide in you. Just as the branch cannot bear fruit by itself unless it abides in the vine, neither can you unless you abide in me.” John 15:4
2025-09-19.daily_watchword: The surviving remnant of the house of Judah shall again take root downward and bear fruit upward. 2 Kings 19:30

2025-09-20.prayer: God, our Father, we yearn to be obedient to follow the Holy Spirit. We have faith that you will lead us down a level path. The path need not be lonely when all your children walk in unison. We pray together. Amen.
2025-09-20.doctrinal: All who are led by the Spirit of God are children of God. Romans 8:14
2025-09-20.daily_watchword: Teach me to do your will, for you are my God. Let your good spirit lead me on a level path. Psalm 143:10

2025-09-21.prayer: God, for generations you have offered us refuge in your kingdom. When we return home, we should be delighted to meet our forebears. These are not ancestors by blood, but fathers and mothers of thought. Help us to be a people that welcomes all and are united by love. Amen.
2025-09-21.doctrinal: Boaz was the father of Obed by Ruth, and Obed the father of Jesse, and Jesse the father of King David. Jacob was the father of Joseph the husband of Mary, who bore Jesus, who is called the Messiah. Matthew 1:5-6,16
2025-09-21.daily_watchword: Ruth said, “Do not press me to leave you, to turn back from following you! Where you go, I will go; where you lodge, I will lodge; your people shall be my people and your God my God.” Ruth 1:16
2025-09-21.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — From the rising of the sun to its setting the name of the Lord is to be praised. Psalm 113:3

2025-09-22.prayer: O Lord, you are the firm foundation on which we stand. We seek to live a righteous life, one built upon your foundation, a life full of honor that endures in you forever. To you, we pray. Amen.
2025-09-22.doctrinal: I no longer have a righteousness of my own, the kind that is gained by obeying the Law. I now have the righteousness that is given through faith in Christ, the righteousness that comes from God and is based on faith. Philippians 3:9 GNT
2025-09-22.daily_watchword: Full of honor and majesty is the Lord’s work, and his righteousness endures forever. Psalm 111:3

2025-09-23.prayer: Jesus, we ask for forgiveness. We hear the call to live pure and clean lives. We acknowledge that we fall short, despite our best efforts. It is by design that we fail, and by design that you offer forgiveness. Please, hear our prayer. Amen.
2025-09-23.doctrinal: God did not call us to be impure, but to live a holy life. 1 Thessalonians 4:7 NIV
2025-09-23.daily_watchword: I will save you from all your uncleannesses. Ezekiel 36:29

2025-09-24.prayer: We are thankful that you forgive our sins, God. You have rescued us and offered us salvation. It is a blessing that we can repay you by sharing this news with all your people. They will know we are Christians by our love. May we show it through our words and actions. Amen.
2025-09-24.doctrinal: In his name the message about repentance and the forgiveness of sins must be preached to all nations. Luke 24:47 GNT
2025-09-24.daily_watchword: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of your name; deliver us and forgive our sins, for your name’s sake. Psalm 79:9

2025-09-25.prayer: Creator of the world, we sing your praise. We rejoice in the fields, and we sing hallelujah in the rain. Nothing can dampen our spirits because the warmth of your love radiates from our hearts. We thankfully sing your praise. Amen.
2025-09-25.doctrinal: Hallelujah! For the Lord God the Almighty reigns. Revelation 19:6
2025-09-25.daily_watchword: The one who forms the mountains, creates the wind, reveals his thoughts to mortals—the Lord, the God of hosts, is his name! Amos 4:13

2025-09-26.prayer: We remain faithful to you, dear Jesus. Our faith is unwavering because you are our strength and shield. Furthermore, we are inspired by the miracles you perform. May we be witnesses to your amazing grace. Amen.
2025-09-26.doctrinal: Then one of them, when he saw that he was healed from the skin disease, turned back, praising God with a loud voice. Luke 17:15
2025-09-26.daily_watchword: Many are saying to me, “There is no help for you in God.” But you, O Lord, are a shield around me, my glory, and the one who lifts up my head. Psalm 3:2-3

2025-09-27.prayer: We are always ready, O Lord. We will follow you whenever you ask. We are prepared to follow you into the world you have conquered, and to be a part of your kingdom. Until then, we pray. Amen.
2025-09-27.doctrinal: Jesus said, “In the world you face persecution, but take courage: I have conquered the world!” John 16:33
2025-09-27.daily_watchword: Do not be afraid, but let your hands be strong. Zechariah 8:13

2025-09-28.prayer: Lord, you entrust us to watch over the least fortunate in life. Help us to look after strangers, the homeless, and disabled. We remember what you told us: when we do it for the least of these, we do it also for you. May we take good care of your people, Lord. Amen.
2025-09-28.doctrinal: Do not forget to show hospitality to strangers, for by so doing some people have shown hospitality to angels without knowing it. Hebrews 13:2 NIV
2025-09-28.daily_watchword: The Lord watches over the strangers; he upholds the orphan and the widow. Psalm 146:9
2025-09-28.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — There is great gain in godliness combined with contentment. 1 Timothy 6:6

2025-09-29.prayer: We try to survive on our own, God. Eventually we need help, and you are the ultimate savior. May we always rely on you, knowing you will graciously be there for us. Thanks be to you, O God. Amen.
2025-09-29.doctrinal: Suddenly an angel of the Lord appeared, and a light shone in the cell. He tapped Peter on the side and woke him, saying, “Get up quickly.” And the chains fell off his wrists. Acts 12:7
2025-09-29.daily_watchword: I am yours; save me. Psalm 119:94

2025-09-30.prayer: Lord, we are grateful that you call us to your eternal glory. When the time is right, we will rise up and come. Until that day, may our resolve to create your image here on Earth never waver. Amen.
2025-09-30.doctrinal: The God of all grace, who has called you to his eternal glory in Christ, will himself restore, support, strengthen, and establish you. 1 Peter 5:10
2025-09-30.daily_watchword: Rise up, come to our help. Redeem us for the sake of your steadfast love. Psalm 44:26

2025-10-01.prayer: God of fortitude, you bolster our bodies and our spirits for the physical work of your church. Guide our hands towards the building of your kingdom and our hearts towards your enduring love. Amen.
2025-10-01.doctrinal: Jesus said, “I know your works, your toil and your endurance.” Revelation 2:2
2025-10-01.daily_watchword: And the Lord stirred up the spirit of all the remnant of the people, and they came and worked on the house of the Lord of hosts, their God. Haggai 1:14

2025-10-02.prayer: Astounding Savior, we give thanks for your bounteous gifts in our daily lives. We pray for open eyes, so that we may continue to see your transforming power at work in and around us. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-10-02.doctrinal: Jesus said to the centurion, “Go; let it be done for you according to your faith.” And the servant was healed in that hour. Matthew 8:13
2025-10-02.daily_watchword: Come and see what God has done: he is awesome in his deeds among mortals. Psalm 66:5

2025-10-03.prayer: Far-speaking Spirit, open our eyes to all our siblings who feel your presence moving among them. Let us be one in community with all our brethren of faith and let us together see your works revealed in the world. Amen.
2025-10-03.doctrinal: Mary Magdalene went and announced to the disciples, “I have seen the Lord,” and she told them that he had said these things to her. John 20:18
2025-10-03.daily_watchword: Who has believed what we have heard? And to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed? Isaiah 53:1
