2025-10-04.prayer: Steadfast Rock, your loyalty to us never wavers. You kept your covenant with us through Jesus Christ, our Lord; we pray for strength to live into the promise of his death. May we be faithful to you, as you are to us. In Christ’s strong name, we pray. Amen.
2025-10-04.doctrinal: The one who calls you is faithful. 1 Thessalonians 5:24
2025-10-04.daily_watchword: Solomon prayed: You have kept your promise to your servant David my father; with your mouth you have promised and with your hand you have fulfilled it— as it is today. 1 Kings 8:24 NIV

2025-10-05.prayer: Lord, we are hungry for your guidance. When we struggle to discern our path, let us feast at the table of your grace. Help us take direction from the words you speak to our hearts. Amen.
2025-10-05.doctrinal: But Jesus answered the disciples, “You give them something to eat.” Mark 6:37
2025-10-05.daily_watchword: Whether it is good or bad, we will obey the voice of the Lord our God. Jeremiah 42:6
2025-10-05.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Commit your way to the Lord; trust in him, and he will act. Psalm 37:5

2025-10-06.prayer: God always with us, we call upon your presence in the now. Help us see and know that your promises are not just for the everlasting, but for each immediate moment here on earth. Let us respond to your grace and power, and walk with you into the future. Amen.
2025-10-06.doctrinal: The prayer of faith will save the sick and the Lord will raise them up, and anyone who has committed sins will be forgiven. James 5:15
2025-10-06.daily_watchword: I believe that I shall see the goodness of the Lord in the land of the living. Psalm 27:13

2025-10-07.prayer: Beacon of hope, fortify us with the assurance of your love and companionship as we journey through life’s many trials. With your steadying hand guiding us, we can weather any storm. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-10-07.doctrinal: Nothing will be impossible with God. Luke 1:37
2025-10-07.daily_watchword: I know that you can do all things and that no purpose of yours can be thwarted. Job 42:2

2025-10-08.prayer: Compassionate Christ, through your life, you showed us how to walk among all of God’s children. May we keep our hearts, hands, and homes open to our neighbors in need. With all-encompassing love, we pray. Amen.
2025-10-08.doctrinal: When Jesus came to the place, he looked up and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for I must stay at your house today.” So, he hurried down and was happy to welcome him. Luke 19:5-6
2025-10-08.daily_watchword: O Lord, you will hear the desire of the meek; you will strengthen their heart. Psalm 10:17

2025-10-09.prayer: Safekeeper of all generations, we are children of your promise. We take strength in the steadfast belief of our ancestors who came before, both those we have known and those unknown to us. Help us to build a world to come, full of your love, set on Christ, the cornerstone. Amen.
2025-10-09.doctrinal: Those who believe are blessed with Abraham who believed. Galatians 3:9
2025-10-09.daily_watchword: The Lord said to Abram, “In you all the families of the earth shall be blessed.” Genesis 12:1,3

2025-10-10.prayer: Master Gardener, you know us as seed, sprout, vine, and crop. You see our potential for bounteous harvest and our tendencies towards errancy and decay. Tend to us with a firm and gentle hand and give us the sweet waters of your guidance, so that we may blossom fully. Amen.
2025-10-10.doctrinal: God has not rejected his people whom he foreknew. Romans 11:2
2025-10-10.daily_watchword: I planted you as a choice vine from the purest stock. How then did you turn degenerate and become a wild vine? Jeremiah 2:21

2025-10-11.prayer: Creator God, let us sing praises to you across your beautiful creation! Help us to see the wonders, both large and small, that you give to us each day, and that we may mark them with gladness. Amen.
2025-10-11.doctrinal: Jesus said, “You will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.” Acts 1:8
2025-10-11.daily_watchword: Lord our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth! Psalm 8:1 NIV

2025-10-12.prayer: Christ, our eternal savior, you speak to us in all times and places. You are our constant, a guiding star for us as we navigate this tumultuous world. Though we change, your works remain our anchor. Let us hear your voice in all our tomorrows and praise your name our whole life long. Amen.
2025-10-12.doctrinal: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever. Hebrews 13:8
2025-10-12.daily_watchword: His authority would last forever, and his kingdom would never end. Daniel 7:14 GNT
2025-10-12.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — If we have died with him, we will also live with him. 2 Timothy 2:11

2025-10-13.prayer: Lord, there are many ailments that afflict us: injuries of the heart, of the body, of the soul, of society. Through your power, we are equipped to face the work of restoration, knitting up hurts and pains, addressing injustices. Move within us a righteous spirit, and set us forth on the path of redemption and mercy. Amen.
2025-10-13.doctrinal: You know that Jesus Christ was revealed to take away sins, and in him there is no sin. 1 John 3:5-6
2025-10-13.daily_watchword: The Lord said, “Your wound is incurable, your injury beyond healing. But I will restore you to health and heal your wounds.” Jeremiah 30:12,17 NIV

2025-10-14.prayer: Merciful Savior, we cry out to you for relief. In our sorrow, despair, and anguish, let us draw closer to you and the promise of your healing love. We yearn for the moment when your arms will enfold us, and your love surround us. Bring your comfort to us, we pray. Amen.
2025-10-14.doctrinal: A woman who had been suffering from a flow of blood for twelve years, and though she had spent all she had on physicians, no one could cure her. She came up behind him and touched the fringe of his cloak, and immediately her flow of blood stopped. Luke 8:43-44
2025-10-14.daily_watchword: You have delivered my soul from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling. Psalm 116:8

2025-10-15.prayer: Lord of the journey, we are but travelers in this world below. Though we may walk far from earthly homes, we know that we always have a home with you in heaven. Guide us safely through our wanderings and welcome us upon our return with joy. Amen.
2025-10-15.doctrinal: The seventy-two returned with joy, saying, “Lord, in your name even the demons submit to us!” Jesus said to them, “Nevertheless, do not rejoice at this, that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.” Luke 10:17-18,20
2025-10-15.daily_watchword: You shall go out in joy and be led back in peace. Isaiah 55:12

2025-10-16.prayer: God to whom we set our prayers, lift our burdens, open the doors! Let us call to you as Christ did, entreating your mercy and sure of your reply. We, with him, have been blessed with the pouring out of your power upon us—let our hearts be steadied. Amen.
2025-10-16.doctrinal: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us in Christ with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places. Ephesians 1:3
2025-10-16.daily_watchword: Do not be afraid, for I am with you and will bless you. Genesis 26:24

2025-10-17.prayer: Comforter and Sustainer, we fix our eyes on you. While we travel on life’s journey, may we feel the shelter of your care. Bring the power of your hands upon us; let us walk forth in the world clothed in your blessings. Amen.
2025-10-17.doctrinal: Then children were being brought to him in order that he might lay his hands on them and pray. Matthew 19:13
2025-10-17.daily_watchword: I will not let you go, unless you bless me. Genesis 32:26

2025-10-18.prayer: Rock of our faith, when we stumble, falter, and fail, we know our most full redemption comes from you. Help us extend your spirit of forgiveness in our own lives, as you have extended it to us. Amen.
2025-10-18.doctrinal: In Jesus Christ we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of our trespasses, according to the riches of his grace. Ephesians 1:7
2025-10-18.daily_watchword: To the Lord our God belong mercy and forgiveness. Daniel 9:9

2025-10-19.prayer: In a world filled with strife, it is too easy to hunger for retribution. Lord, let us forsake the quick but cruel sword; be our shield against anger and hatred. Guide our hearts towards lasting peace and our hands towards the enduring work of turning swords to plowshares, we pray. Amen.
2025-10-19.doctrinal: Lord, should we strike with the sword? Luke 22:49
2025-10-19.daily_watchword: O God, do not keep silent; do not hold your peace or be still, O God! Even now your enemies are in tumult; those who hate you have raised their heads. Psalm 83:1-2
2025-10-19.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Proclaim the message; be persistent whether the time is favorable or unfavorable; convince, rebuke, and encourage, with the utmost patience in teaching. 2 Timothy 4:2

2025-10-20.prayer: Resplendent Nurturer, you entrust the caretaking of your magnificent creation to us. Yet we see how all too easy it is to conquer and exploit this gift. Help us turn away from the allure of greed and the promise of material reward and orient us towards the joy of living in harmony with your bountiful earth. Amen.
2025-10-20.doctrinal: Again, the devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory, and he said to him, “All these I will give you, if you will fall down and worship me.” Then Jesus said to him, “Away with you, Satan!” Matthew 4:8-10
2025-10-20.daily_watchword: His dominion shall be from sea to sea and to the ends of the earth. Zechariah 9:10

2025-10-21.prayer: Light on our path, you send us out into the world to be a light unto others. Let us walk with curiosity and open-hearted wonder among your people, all of whom are our kin. As we return to our own communities, empower us to bring those connections home with us. O great Connector, Holy Spirit, to you, we pray. Amen.
2025-10-21.doctrinal: For we are the people he called, not only from among the Jews but also from among the Gentiles. Romans 9:24 GNT
2025-10-21.daily_watchword: Abram went, as the Lord had told him. Genesis 12:4

2025-10-22.prayer: Sometimes the disasters of the world are too much for our hearts to bear, O God. When hardship befalls us, you are there. When our communities are hurting, you are there. When we long to tear our eyes from the injustices of the world, you are there. Bring us steadfast companionship and sweet consolation as a balm to our broken hearts. This we most urgently pray. Amen.
2025-10-22.doctrinal: Our hope for you is unshaken, for we know that as you share in our sufferings, so also you share in our consolation. 2 Corinthians 1:7
2025-10-22.daily_watchword: Thus said the Lord, “Just as I have brought all this great disaster upon this people, so I will bring upon them all the good fortune that I now promise them.” Jeremiah 32:42

2025-10-23.prayer: God of abiding love, hold us close to you as your most precious children. Nourish us; nurture us; wrap us in your care. Let us face each new day leading with love, as you have taught us. Amen.
2025-10-23.daily_watchword: Can a woman forget her nursing child or show no compassion for the child of her womb? Even these might forget, yet I will not forget you. Isaiah 49:15

2025-10-24.prayer: God of everlasting promise, you gave us your son, Jesus Christ, to give us hope on earth. He died to give us hope for things to come. The spirit lives with us as a reminder of that covenant, and through the presence of the Holy Spirit, we know that you remain with us. We renew our troth to you every morning as we pray. Amen.
2025-10-24.doctrinal: In the ages to come God might show the immeasurable riches of his grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus. Ephesians 2:7
2025-10-24.daily_watchword: “There is hope for your future,” says the Lord. Jeremiah 31:17

2025-10-25.prayer: Lord of the hungry, when we look to you for nourishment, you provide not only for our empty bellies, but also for our empty hearts. The gift of your dear son has sustained us as the bread of life, filling our bodies and souls. We thank you for this most precious communion. Amen.
2025-10-25.doctrinal: The bread of God is that which comes down from heaven and gives life to the world. John 6:33
2025-10-25.daily_watchword: You shall eat your bread to the full and live securely in your land. Leviticus 26:5

2025-10-26.prayer: Beneficent Savior, we know that your ministry was among the people. You made peers of the tax collectors and the prostitutes, and you were a friend of fishermen. May our own communities include the overlooked, building bonds of love, where all too easily there could be dismissal and exclusion. Help us every day to live into the promise of your all-inclusive grace. Amen.
2025-10-26.doctrinal: If a person with gold rings and in fine clothes comes into your assembly, and if a poor person in dirty clothes also comes in, and if you take notice of the one wearing the fine clothes and say, “Have a seat here in a good place, please,” while to the one who is poor you say, “Stand there,” or, “Sit by my footstool,” have you not made distinctions among yourselves and become judges with evil thoughts? James 2:2-4
2025-10-26.daily_watchword: Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due, when it is in your power to do it. Proverbs 3:27
2025-10-26.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Jesus said, “All who exalt themselves will be humbled, but all who humble themselves will be exalted.” Luke 18:14

2025-10-27.prayer: God of the helping hand, you feed your flock with a rich feast of spiritual and material blessings. As we recognize your gracious generosity in our lives, let us turn outwards and offer those blessings among your people, for your sake. Make us a force for your abounding joy. Amen.
2025-10-27.doctrinal: John the Baptist said, “Whoever has two coats must share with anyone who has none, and whoever has food must do likewise.” Luke 3:11
2025-10-27.daily_watchword: The eyes of all look to you, and you give them their food in due season. You open your hand, satisfying the desire of every living thing. Psalm 145:15-16

2025-10-28.prayer: O most human Christ, by walking among us, you clearly saw the many ways our hearts could turn from good. When we falter on the path you set before us, bring to us mercy and guidance to help us find the course of true righteousness. This we humbly pray. Amen.
2025-10-28.doctrinal: Jesus said, “It is what comes out of a person that defiles.” Mark 7:20
2025-10-28.daily_watchword: Pride goes before destruction and a haughty spirit before a fall. Proverbs 16:18

2025-10-29.prayer: Lord and Comforter, what a joy to be enfolded in your tender care! Your love and warmth suffuse us. Let the light and assurance we feel from you shine through us this day. Radiant Lord, in your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-10-29.doctrinal: Jesus said, “If you keep my commandments, you will abide in my love, just as I have kept my Father’s commandments and abide in his love.” John 15:10
2025-10-29.daily_watchword: The Lord said, “If you obey my voice and keep my covenant, you shall be my treasured possession out of all the peoples. Indeed, the whole earth is mine.” Exodus 19:5

2025-10-30.prayer: When we know hardship and suffering, Lord, bring us closer to your love. Let us be renewed through the gift of your blessed assurance. Help us turn to our neighbors, and act as your agents in the world, outstretching the hand of comfort and love for them as you did for us. Enfold and empower us, Lord, we pray. Amen.
2025-10-30.doctrinal: God consoles us in all our affliction, so that we may be able to console those who are in any affliction with the consolation with which we ourselves are consoled by God. 2 Corinthians 1:4
2025-10-30.daily_watchword: O Lord, save my life; deliver me for the sake of your steadfast love. Psalm 6:4

2025-10-31.prayer: Lord, daily we wrestle with how best to draw close to you. When we fear you have turned your face away from us—in moments of spite, or anger, or hurt—bring us reminders of your unrelenting grace. Stay with us and draw us close. In your name, we humbly pray. Amen.
2025-10-31.doctrinal: There is no distinction, since all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God; they are now justified by his grace as a gift, through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus. Romans 3:22-24
2025-10-31.daily_watchword: “Why do you bring charges against me? You have all rebelled against me,” declares the Lord. Jeremiah 2:29 NIV

2025-11-01.prayer: Wise Teacher, on this All Saints Day, we remember your saints, past and present. You guided them and planted seeds within them that grew. Just as your love grew in them, may they inspire us in our own spiritual growth. Amen.
2025-11-01.doctrinal: Jesus said, “But the seed on good soil stands for those with a noble and good heart, who hear the word, retain it, and by persevering produce a crop.” Luke 8:15 NIV
2025-11-01.daily_watchword: I shall not be put to shame, having my eyes fixed on all your commandments. Psalm 119:6
special_remarks: Watchword for All Saints Day — Salvation belongs to our God who is seated on the throne, and to the Lamb! Revelation 7:10

2025-11-02.prayer: God, our spirit friend, you have made and chosen us to be your people. You dwell among us and within us. We sing our praises to you that you are always with us! Amen.
2025-11-02.doctrinal: God will dwell with them; they will be his peoples, and God himself will be with them and be their God. Revelation 21:3
2025-11-02.daily_watchword: Many nations shall join themselves to the Lord on that day and shall be my people. Zechariah 2:11
2025-11-02.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Jesus said, “For the son of man came to seek and to save the lost.” Luke 19:10

2025-11-03.prayer: Merciful Father, when we feel alone, just knowing that you are always there to compassionately stand up for us through our troubles and tribulations gives us hope. Your love and mercy have drawn us near and given us life. Thank you. Amen.
2025-11-03.doctrinal: Since, then, we have a great high priest who has passed through the heavens, Jesus, the Son of God, let us hold fast to our confession. Hebrews 4:14
2025-11-03.daily_watchword: Even now my witness is in heaven, and my advocate is on high. Job 16:19

2025-11-04.prayer: Our redeeming God, we trust in you to direct and protect us through life. As a young child takes their parent’s hand crossing the street, so you take our hand to guide us. We can face the future and not be afraid. Thank you for your protection. Amen.
2025-11-04.doctrinal: So you also must consider yourselves dead to sin and alive to God in Christ Jesus. Romans 6:11
2025-11-04.daily_watchword: I walk before the Lord in the land of the living. Psalm 116:9

2025-11-05.prayer: Merciful God, you have always made us feel worthy, even when we examine ourselves and know that we do not measure up to your expectations. We pray for knowledge of what truly matters in our lives so that we may release the trivial. Amen.
2025-11-05.doctrinal: This is my prayer, that your love may overflow more and more with knowledge and full insight to help you to determine what really matters, so that in the day of Christ you may be pure and blameless. Philippians 1:9-10
2025-11-05.daily_watchword: Let us test and examine our ways and return to the Lord. Lamentations 3:40

2025-11-06.prayer: Compassionate Lord, we are thankful you do not treat us according to our sin but sent your son to veil our transgressions. You are merciful, even when we deserve your anger and rebuke. We ask for your forgiveness. Amen.
2025-11-06.doctrinal: The angel said to Joseph, “Mary will bear a son, and you are to name him Jesus, for he will save his people from their sins.” Matthew 1:21
2025-11-06.daily_watchword: For my name’s sake I defer my anger; for the sake of my praise I restrain it for you, so that I may not cut you off. Isaiah 48:9

2025-11-07.prayer: Gracious God, you listen when we ask; you are present when we search; and you open the door wide when we knock. You are ever-present in our lives and worthy of all our praise. Thank you. Amen.
2025-11-07.doctrinal: “Blessed is the king who comes in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven, and glory in the highest heaven!” Luke 19:38
2025-11-07.daily_watchword: May all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you. Psalm 40:16

2025-11-08.prayer: God of light, the sun feels so good upon our face in the middle of winter, but to be in your light is unimaginably better. May we reflect your light and share your warmth with all people! Amen.
2025-11-08.doctrinal: Jesus said, “I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness but will have the light of life.” John 8:12
2025-11-08.daily_watchword: I will lead the blind by a road they do not know; by paths they have not known I will guide them. Isaiah 42:16

2025-11-09.prayer: Precious Lord, too many times we reject your ways and seek comfort elsewhere. Help us remember that you are the source of everything we need. May our eyes see, and lips tell of all the great and wonderful things you have made! Amen.
2025-11-09.doctrinal: Ever since God created the world, his invisible qualities, both his eternal power and his divine nature, have been clearly seen; they are perceived in the things that God has made. Romans 1:20 GNT
2025-11-09.daily_watchword: So be careful, lest you forget the covenant that the Lord your God made with you and make for yourselves an idol in the form of anything that the Lord your God has forbidden you. Deuteronomy 4:23
2025-11-09.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — For I know that my Redeemer lives, and that at the last he will stand upon the earth. Job 19:25

2025-11-10.prayer: Abba, Father, sometimes it is in the stillness that we can hear you best. Sometimes when we pray, we are so busy saying our words and distracted by our thoughts, that we’re not listening. Open our eyes, ears, mind, and heart to discern your will. Amen.
2025-11-10.doctrinal: Let anyone who has an ear listen to what the Spirit is saying to the churches. Revelation 2:7
2025-11-10.daily_watchword: Why do you contend against God, saying, “He will answer none of my words?” For God speaks in one way and in two, though people do not perceive it. Job 33:13-14

2025-11-11.prayer: Almighty Healer, the balm that you offer to the world is soothing and comforting. Why are we so often afraid to accept it? Help us to trust and believe in you whenever we experience the struggles and storms of life. In your name, we pray. Amen.
2025-11-11.doctrinal: Jesus touched their eyes and said, “According to your faith, let it be done to you.” And their eyes were opened. Matthew 9:29-30
2025-11-11.daily_watchword: Do not fear or be dismayed. Joshua 8:1

2025-11-12.prayer: God of justice, so often we take it upon ourselves to judge others by appearances, social status, or petty grievances. Help us to remember that, as your servants, our task is to love, forgive, console, and understand. Amen.
2025-11-12.doctrinal: But if you show partiality, you commit sin and are convicted by the law as transgressors. James 2:9
2025-11-12.daily_watchword: You must not be partial in judging: hear out the small and the great alike; you shall not be intimidated by anyone, for the judgment is God’s. Deuteronomy 1:17

2025-11-13.prayer: Jesus Christ, our Chief Elder, head of the church, and head of our faith, help us to be strong in faith as we remember that you are head of every authority and governing body. Give us vision, guidance, and grace to carry out your plan. Amen.
2025-11-13.doctrinal: Thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ. 1 Corinthians 15:57
2025-11-13.daily_watchword: Lord I rejoice in your victory. 1 Samuel 2:1

2025-11-14.prayer: Gentle Shepherd, bring us close to you to comfort and calm our fears. Through the unexpected struggles we face, you have always been there to provide for us. May we fully trust in your amazing care. Amen.
2025-11-14.doctrinal: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all; no one can snatch them out of my Father’s hand. John 10:29 NIV
2025-11-14.daily_watchword: As an eagle stirs up its nest, and hovers over its young, the Lord spread his wings, he caught them, he carried them on his pinions. Deuteronomy 32:10-12 NASB

2025-11-15.prayer: God Almighty, we trust that the sun will rise in the morning and set in the evening, but we do not always trust in the things we cannot see or feel. Help us to trust in you—the rock on which our faith depends. Amen.
2025-11-15.doctrinal: The aim of such instruction is love that comes from a pure heart, a good conscience, and sincere faith. 1 Timothy 1:5
2025-11-15.daily_watchword: Satisfy us in the morning with your steadfast love, so that we may rejoice and be glad all our days. Psalm 90:14

2025-11-16.prayer: Forgiving God, you call us to forgive others as you forgive us. Too often we do not extend forgiveness to ourselves and others. Help us to remember what your loving, forgiving, anger-dispelling embrace feels like when forgiveness isn’t our initial response. Amen.
2025-11-16.doctrinal: While they were stoning Stephen, he prayed, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.” Acts 7:59
2025-11-16.daily_watchword: The Lord regarded their distress when he heard their cry. For their sake he remembered his covenant. Psalm 106:44-45
2025-11-16.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Brothers and sisters, do not be weary in doing what is right. 2 Thessalonians 3:13

2025-11-17.prayer: Faithful Lord, blessed to be a blessing are we as your children. May we comfort and uplift others who feel persecuted, sorrowful, and rejected. Let them know they are blessed and loved, too. Amen.
2025-11-17.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Blessed are you when people revile you and persecute you and utter all kinds of evil against you falsely on my account. Rejoice and be glad, for your reward is great in heaven.” Matthew 5:11-12
2025-11-17.daily_watchword: All the paths of the Lord are steadfast love and faithfulness, for those who keep his covenant and his decrees. Psalm 25:10

2025-11-18.prayer: God of Abraham, you made a covenant that you kept when you claimed us as your people. Abraham had a great faith and believed you, even through his advancing age. May we be equally faithful as we promise to keep your word within our hearts and minds. Amen.
2025-11-18.doctrinal: Hoping against hope, Abraham believed that he would become “the father of many nations.” Romans 4:18
2025-11-18.daily_watchword: The Lord is a shield for all who take refuge in him. Psalm 18:30

2025-11-19.prayer: God of every nation, we live in a time of hatred, war, and despair. Help us to know that you are our refuge and strength throughout. We have hope that one day the world will be at peace, and truth and justice will reign. Amen.
2025-11-19.doctrinal: Jesus called the disciples to him and said, “You know that the rulers of the gentiles lord it over them, and their great ones are tyrants over them. It will not be so among you.” Matthew 20:25-26
2025-11-19.daily_watchword: Woe to those who devise wickedness because it is in their power. Micah 2:1

2025-11-20.prayer: Breath of life, when we concentrate on our breathing, it reminds us to slow our racing minds and anxious hearts. Help us to be still and know that you are God, and we are yours. Strengthen and comfort us, we pray. Amen.
2025-11-20.doctrinal: It is no longer I who live, but it is Christ who lives in me. And the life I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved me and gave himself for me. Galatians 2:20
2025-11-20.daily_watchword: The Lord God formed man from the dust of the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living being. Genesis 2:7

2025-11-21.prayer: Unchanging God, we pray for your guidance in our decisions. May what we do be for your glory. Abide with us and give us hope, strength, and confidence to do the things you would have us do. Amen.
2025-11-21.doctrinal: Jesus said, “If you continue in my word, you are truly my disciples, and you will know the truth, and the truth will make you free.” John 8:31-32
2025-11-21.daily_watchword: O Lord God, you are God, and your words are true. 2 Samuel 7:28

2025-11-22.prayer: Merciful Lord, you are our shining example of forgiveness. Despite our unpaid debts, deeds left undone, and flaws we wish we could fix, you have given us your son, Jesus, who upon the cross, wiped our slate clean. Knowing this, how can we not forgive others? Amen.
2025-11-22.doctrinal: Forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors. Matthew 6:12
2025-11-22.daily_watchword: I am merciful, says the Lord; I will not be angry forever. Only acknowledge your guilt, that you have rebelled against the Lord your God. Jeremiah 3:12-13

2025-11-23.prayer: God of light and truth, you are a light unto the world. Give us a willing heart to be beacons of faith, love, and hope to those in darkness. With thanksgiving, we pray in your holy name. Amen.
2025-11-23.doctrinal: During the night Paul had a vision: there stood a man of Macedonia pleading with him and saying, “Come over to Macedonia and help us.” When he had seen the vision, we immediately tried to cross over to Macedonia, being convinced that God had called us to proclaim the good news to them. Acts 16:9-10
2025-11-23.daily_watchword: The Lord said, “I will give you as a light to the nations, that my salvation may reach to the end of the earth.” Isaiah 49:6
2025-11-23.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Be still, and know that I am God! I am exalted among the nations, I am exalted in the earth. Psalm 46:10

2025-11-24.prayer: Spirit of the living God, fall afresh on us. Open our hearts and minds to be receptive to your Spirit. Inspire us to go out to serve our neighbors and witness to your love, mercy, and grace. Amen.
2025-11-24.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Whoever is not against us is for us.” Mark 9:40
2025-11-24.daily_watchword: King Nebuchadnezzar said, “The signs and wonders that the Most High God has worked for me I am pleased to recount.” Daniel 4:2

2025-11-25.prayer: Saving God, you sent Jesus to us to show us what perfect love is. We ask for your divine guidance so that your love may unfold in us. Grant us this day, and every day, the strength to hold onto your promises. Amen.
2025-11-25.doctrinal: Having been made perfect, Jesus became the source of eternal salvation for all who obey him. Hebrews 5:9
2025-11-25.daily_watchword: The Lord will fulfill his purpose for me. Psalm 138:8

2025-11-26.prayer: There are times when we get too wrapped up in our own lives, merciful God, and we forget to come to you. Thank you for your loving faithfulness and for always being there with encouragement that draws us closer to you. Amen.
2025-11-26.doctrinal: Let us hold fast to the confession of our hope without wavering, for he who has promised is faithful. Hebrews 10:23
2025-11-26.daily_watchword: Lord, you have plans formed of old, faithful, and sure. Isaiah 25:1

2025-11-27.prayer: Eternal Father, we thank you for being there when we cry out, “Lord, save me!” When we call out in times of distress, fear, and anxiety, open our eyes to your compassionate presence and the blessings around us that you provide. Amen.
2025-11-27.doctrinal: When Peter noticed the strong wind, he became frightened, and, beginning to sink, he cried out, “Lord, save me!” Jesus immediately reached out his hand and caught him. Matthew 14:30-31
2025-11-27.daily_watchword: God said, “In distress you called, and I rescued you.” Psalm 81:7

2025-11-28.prayer: Omnipotent God, you desire a humble and contrite heart. We confess that we have been weighed down by earthly distractions. Help us know what it is that holds us back and keeps us from following you without any reservation. We pray for your guidance. Amen.
2025-11-28.doctrinal: Nathanael replied, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!” John 1:49
2025-11-28.daily_watchword: For as the new heavens and the new earth, which I will make, shall remain before me, says the Lord, so shall your descendants and your name remain. Isaiah 66:22

2025-11-29.prayer: Father, to be anywhere with you is home to us. Help us grow closer to you each day with practices of prayer, worship, and love for each other and for you. Lead us in our walk through life to an eternal life in your house. Amen.
2025-11-29.doctrinal: Jesus said to his parents, “Why were you searching for me? Did you not know that I must be in my Father’s house?” Luke 2:49
2025-11-29.daily_watchword: A day in your courts is better than a thousand elsewhere. Psalm 84:10

2025-11-30.prayer: Gracious King and Savior, we delight in your promise of living in your kingdom when our days are done, and we sing your praises evermore. Equip us with gifts for service here on earth so that we are deemed ready at your call. Amen.
2025-11-30.doctrinal: When the chief priests and the scribes saw the amazing things that he did and heard the children crying out in the temple and saying, “Hosanna to the Son of David,” they became angry and said to him, “Do you hear what these are saying?” Jesus said to them, “Yes; have you never read, ‘Out of the mouths of infants and nursing babies you have prepared praise for yourself?’” Matthew 21:15-16
2025-11-30.daily_watchword: No longer shall they teach one another or say to each other, “Know the Lord,” for they shall all know me, from the least of them to the greatest, says the Lord. Jeremiah 31:34
2025-11-30.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Come, let us walk in the light of the Lord! Isaiah 2:5

2025-12-01.prayer: Light of the world, mold us to bring your light to a world that desperately needs it. May your salvation light up the darkness of all that separates us as children of God. Amen.
2025-12-01.doctrinal: Simeon said, “Master, now you are dismissing your servant in peace, according to your word, for my eyes have seen your salvation, which you have prepared in the presence of all peoples, a light for revelation to the Gentiles and for glory to your people Israel.” Luke 2:29-32
2025-12-01.daily_watchword: O send out your light and your truth; let them lead me to your dwelling. Psalm 43:3

2025-12-02.prayer: Dear Jesus, help us to be inspired and excited to share your good news with the world. May we always be guided by the fact you came to save and not condemn the world. Amen.
2025-12-02.doctrinal: Paul said, “We bring you good news, that you should turn from these worthless things to the living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all that is in them.” Acts 14:15
2025-12-02.daily_watchword: Restore me, and I will return, because you are the Lord my God. Jeremiah 31:18 NIV

2025-12-03.prayer: Holy Spirit, help us to trust that you are doing miraculous things in our world today. Call us to witness and participate in the miraculous beauty around us. Amen.
2025-12-03.doctrinal: You will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you. Acts 1:8
2025-12-03.daily_watchword: Would that all the Lord’s people were prophets and that the Lord would put his Spirit on them! Numbers 11:29

2025-12-04.prayer: Heavenly Father, help us to remember that we are not the source of salvation. We are the ones called to show others just how impactful it can be to serve your kingdom. Amen.
2025-12-04.doctrinal: And, fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in the discipline and instruction of the Lord. Ephesians 6:4
2025-12-04.daily_watchword: Your descendants who have never heard the Law of the Lord your God will hear it. And so they will learn to obey him. Deuteronomy 31:13 GNT

2025-12-05.prayer: Christ, you are the morning star that guides us on the path of salvation. May we courageously stand united with all children of God in need. Amen.
2025-12-05.doctrinal: Salvation is from the Jews. John 4:22
2025-12-05.daily_watchword: Show us your steadfast love, O Lord, and grant us your salvation. Psalm 85:7

2025-12-06.prayer: Holy Spirit, may we feel your presence descend upon us as we seek you through prayer. Guide us to succeed in serving you in our daily lives. Amen.
2025-12-06.doctrinal: The Holy Spirit said, “Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them.” Then after fasting and praying they laid their hands on them and sent them off. Acts 13:2-3
2025-12-06.daily_watchword: Lord save us! Lord, grant us success! Psalm 118:25 NIV

2025-12-07.prayer: Great Comforter, help us to remember that it is okay for us to cry when we feel sad or brokenhearted. Empower us to remember, in the midst of our pain, that those tears never get the last word. Amen.
2025-12-07.doctrinal: Very truly, I tell you, you will weep and mourn, but the world will rejoice; you will have pain, but your pain will turn into joy. John 16:20
2025-12-07.daily_watchword: The Lord lifts up those who are bowed down. Psalm 146:8
2025-12-07.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Repent, for the kingdom of heaven has come near. Matthew 3:2

2025-12-08.prayer: Lord of sinners, help us to remember that there is no wrong turn or wrong path from which you cannot rescue us. May we seek your warm and tender embrace in our times of struggle. Amen.
2025-12-08.doctrinal: Paul wrote: Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners—of whom I am the foremost. But for that very reason I received mercy, so that in me, as the foremost, Jesus Christ might display the utmost patience as an example to those who would come to believe in him for eternal life. 1 Timothy 1:15-16
2025-12-08.daily_watchword: Return to your God; hold fast to love and justice, and wait continually for your God. Hosea 12:6

2025-12-09.prayer: Great Comforter, help us to remember that, when trials and tribulations come in life, you are not a God that runs away, but you find ways to pull us closer to your love. For that tenderness, we give thanks. Amen.
2025-12-09.doctrinal: Show respect for widows who really are all alone. 1 Timothy 5:3 GNT
2025-12-09.daily_watchword: Even when you turn gray I will carry you. I have made, and I will bear; I will carry and will save. Isaiah 46:4

2025-12-10.prayer: Alpha and Omega, on the days we feel powerless to change the world with Christ’s love, help us to see that you have the power and might to make those changes a reality. Amen.
2025-12-10.doctrinal: I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last, the Beginning and the End. Revelation 22:13
2025-12-10.daily_watchword: You are great, O Lord God, for there is no one like you, and there is no God besides you, according to all that we have heard with our ears. 2 Samuel 7:22

2025-12-11.prayer: God of love, may we pay attention to how much you love us and love this world. Call us to bear witness to the eternal life that you bring to the world. Amen.
2025-12-11.doctrinal: For God so loved the world that he gave his only Son, so that everyone who believes in him may not perish but may have eternal life. John 3:16
2025-12-11.daily_watchword: I have loved you with an everlasting love; therefore I have continued my faithfulness to you. Jeremiah 31:3

2025-12-12.prayer: Dear Jesus, call us to see that your heavenly father flung wide the gates of heaven to bring you to us so that we would witness a perfect example of how to serve humanity. Amen.
2025-12-12.doctrinal: The angel said to Mary, “You will conceive in your womb and bear a son, and you will name him Jesus. He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High.” Luke 1:31-32
2025-12-12.daily_watchword: O that you would tear open the heavens and come down. Isaiah 64:1

2025-12-13.prayer: Gracious God, help us to shape our cities and our neighborhoods by the barometer of Christ’s love. Help us to judge our communities not on the basis of material possessions, but from a place of selfless giving. Amen.
2025-12-13.doctrinal: And I saw the holy city, the new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband. And I heard a loud voice from the throne saying, “See, the home of God is among mortals.” Revelation 21:2-3
2025-12-13.daily_watchword: The days are surely coming, says the Lord, when the city shall be rebuilt for the Lord. Jeremiah 31:38

2025-12-14.prayer: Holy Ghost, help us to listen with the faith of the centurion. May we be reminded of how much you can accomplish with even a faint whisper of compassion. Amen.
2025-12-14.doctrinal: The centurion asked Jesus, “But only speak the word, and let my servant be healed.” Luke 7:7
2025-12-14.daily_watchword: To you, O Lord, I call; my rock, do not refuse to hear me. Psalm 28:1
2025-12-14.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Be strong, do not fear! Here is your God. Isaiah 35:4

2025-12-15.prayer: Dear Jesus, may we remember that you were crucified to remove the burden of sin from the world. May our thanks be moved to tears when we see our reflection in your wounds. Amen.
2025-12-15.doctrinal: God, who did not withhold his own Son but gave him up for all of us, how will he not with him also give us everything else? Romans 8:32
2025-12-15.daily_watchword: He was wounded for our transgressions, crushed for our iniquities. Isaiah 53:5

2025-12-16.prayer: Prince of peace, waiting for you to come this Christmas season is filled with anxiety. Help us to see that waiting can be a productive space to occupy if we use that time to serve the needs of our world. Amen.
2025-12-16.doctrinal: We wait for the blessed hope and the manifestation of the glory of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ. Titus 2:13
2025-12-16.daily_watchword: For God alone my soul waits in silence, for my hope is from him. Psalm 62:5

2025-12-17.prayer: Lord of light, help us to stand for justice and righteousness in our world. May our loyalty be to your voice and wisdom and not those who seek power to abuse others. Amen.
2025-12-17.doctrinal: Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good. Romans 12:21
2025-12-17.daily_watchword: Woe to those who call evil good and good evil, who put darkness for light and light for darkness. Isaiah 5:20

2025-12-18.prayer: Abba, bless us with strength and courage to change our ways when they block us from loving our Lord and our neighbor. It is never too late to make a positive change for God. Amen.
2025-12-18.doctrinal: For this very reason, you must make every effort to support your faith with excellence, and excellence with knowledge, and knowledge with self-control, and self-control with endurance, and endurance with godliness, and godliness with mutual affection, and mutual affection with love. 2 Peter 1:5-7
2025-12-18.daily_watchword: Reform your ways and your actions, and I will let you live in this place. Jeremiah 7:3 NIV

2025-12-19.prayer: Heavenly Father, give us the strength to survive these dark days. Help us to rest our hope on your light which waits for us on the horizon. Amen.
2025-12-19.doctrinal: Be strong in the Lord and in the strength of his power. Ephesians 6:10
2025-12-19.daily_watchword: There is no Rock like our God. 1 Samuel 2:2

2025-12-20.prayer: Holy Spirit, help our faith be practical. Equip us to carry out small acts of kindness and forgiveness for our families, friends, and community. Amen.
2025-12-20.doctrinal: Be kind to one another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, as God in Christ has forgiven you. Ephesians 4:32
2025-12-20.daily_watchword: Joseph reassured his brothers, speaking kindly to them. Genesis 50:21

2025-12-21.prayer: Merciful Savior, help us to remember that as we wait impatiently for the Christmas gifts we will receive, we already receive the blessed gift of your mercy every single day. Amen.
2025-12-21.doctrinal: When the goodness and loving kindness of God our Savior appeared, he saved us, not because of any works of righteousness that we had done, but according to his mercy. Titus 3:4-5
2025-12-21.daily_watchword: All these things my hand has made, so all these things are mine, says the Lord. But this is the one to whom I will look, to the humble and contrite in spirit who trembles at my word. Isaiah 66:2
2025-12-21.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — Restore us, O Lord God of hosts; let your face shine, that we may be saved. Psalm 80:19

2025-12-22.prayer: Dear Jesus, help us to be faithful to our Christian witness in our lives and in our world. May we honor the pledges we have made to you. Amen.
2025-12-22.doctrinal: Jesus said, “Whoever is faithful in a very little is faithful also in much, and whoever is dishonest in a very little is dishonest also in much.” Luke 16:10
2025-12-22.daily_watchword: Alas for you who heap up what is not your own! How long will you load yourselves with goods taken in pledge? Habakkuk 2:6

2025-12-23.prayer: Dear Jesus, help us to see that when we sow seeds of faith, hope, and love around us, we can see your reflection in all our labors of love. Amen.
2025-12-23.doctrinal: The one who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and the one who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully. 2 Corinthians 9:6
2025-12-23.daily_watchword: Take courage, all you people of the land, says the Lord; work, for I am with you. Haggai 2:4

2025-12-24.prayer: Prince of peace, help us to pay homage to your glorious birth. May we sing the glories of your justice and righteousness in our hearts tonight. Amen.
2025-12-24.doctrinal: The word became flesh and lived among us, and we have seen his glory, the glory as of a father’s only son, full of grace and truth. John 1:14
2025-12-24.daily_watchword: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne; steadfast love and faithfulness go before you. Psalm 89:14

2025-12-25.prayer: Christ Child, help us to see you as the greatest gift that has ever been given to the world. May we rejoice in the glory of God’s greatest gift. Amen.
2025-12-25.doctrinal: To you is born this day in the city of David a Savior, who is the Messiah, the Lord. Luke 2:11
2025-12-25.daily_watchword: Restore us to yourself, O Lord, that we may be restored; renew our days as of old. Lamentations 5:21
special_remarks: Watchword for Christmas Day — The law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ. John 1:17

2025-12-26.prayer: Dear Jesus, open the eyes of our hearts to share your compassion, mercy, and unconditional love with the world. Amen.
2025-12-26.doctrinal: And all who sat in the council looked intently at Stephen, and they saw that his face was like the face of an angel. Acts 6:15
2025-12-26.daily_watchword: The commandment of the Lord is clear, enlightening the eyes. Psalm 19:8

2025-12-27.prayer: Almighty God, help us to see that your hands are extended to the entire world. We are blessed that all children of God can claim you as a loving presence. Amen.
2025-12-27.doctrinal: We proclaim to those who are the called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ the power of God and the wisdom of God. 1 Corinthians 1:23,24
2025-12-27.daily_watchword: I will come praising the mighty deeds of the Lord God; I will praise your righteousness, yours alone. Psalm 71:16

2025-12-28.prayer: O heavenly Peace, call us to live lives dedicated to making your kindness seen throughout our communities. May we be your ambassadors of peace in the world around us. Amen.
2025-12-28.doctrinal: Glory to God in the highest heaven, and on earth peace among those whom he favors! Luke 2:14
2025-12-28.daily_watchword: How very good and pleasant it is when kindred live together in unity! For there the Lord ordained his blessing, life forevermore. Psalm 133:1,3
2025-12-28.weekly_watchword: Watchword for the week — I will recount the gracious deeds of the Lord, the praiseworthy acts of the Lord, because of all that the Lord has done for us. Isaiah 63:7

2025-12-29.prayer: Great Physician, help us to have the humility to come to you for true healing. Let us trust you to be the balm for all the emotional, physical, and spiritual pain we carry. Amen.
2025-12-29.doctrinal: The power of the Lord was with Jesus to heal. Luke 5:17
2025-12-29.daily_watchword: But you, O Lord, do not be far away! O my help, come quickly to my aid! Psalm 22:19

2025-12-30.prayer: Dear Jesus, we are grateful for a personal relationship with you. We know that you care about every thought we have, even before it is formed. May we strive to know you just as intimately. Amen.
2025-12-30.doctrinal: God’s firm foundation stands, bearing this inscription: “The Lord knows those who are his.” 2 Timothy 2:19
2025-12-30.daily_watchword: The Lord said to Moses, “You have found favor in my sight, and I know you by name.” Exodus 33:17

2025-12-31.prayer: Prince of peace, call us to be your peacemakers. May the peace we share with this world reflect the peace you give to us each day. Amen.
2025-12-31.doctrinal: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called children of God. Matthew 5:9
2025-12-31.daily_watchword: The Lord grants peace within your borders. Psalm 147:14
